📝 Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json print("=== INSPECTING WORKSPACE AND ACCESSING PROMISING SCIENCEDIRECT SOURCES ===\n") # First, let's inspect the workspace directory structure workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0] print(f"Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") "keyword">else: workspace_dir = &#x27;workspace' print(f"Using default workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") print(f"\nFiles "keyword">in workspace:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # Let's inspect the promising sources file structure first promising_sources_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;promising_sciencedirect_sources.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(promising_sources_file): print(f"\n=== INSPECTING PROMISING SOURCES FILE STRUCTURE ===\n") # Read first 500 characters to understand structure "keyword">with open(promising_sources_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: sample_content = f.read(500) print("First 500 characters of promising sources file:") print(sample_content) print("...\n") # Load "keyword">and examine the structure "keyword">with open(promising_sources_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: promising_sources = json.load(f) print(f"Promising sources file structure:") print(f" Data type: {type(promising_sources)}") "keyword">if isinstance(promising_sources, list): print(f" List "keyword">with {len(promising_sources)} items") "keyword">if promising_sources: print(f" Sample item keys: {list(promising_sources[0].keys())}") "keyword">elif isinstance(promising_sources, dict): print(f" Dictionary "keyword">with keys: {list(promising_sources.keys())}") # Display the most promising sources print(f"\n=== TOP PROMISING SCIENCEDIRECT SOURCES ===\n") "keyword">if isinstance(promising_sources, list) "keyword">and promising_sources: top_sources = promising_sources[:5] # Get top 5 sources "keyword">for i, source "keyword">in enumerate(top_sources, 1): print(f"{i}. {source.get(&#x27;title', 'No title')}") print(f" URL: {source.get(&#x27;url', 'No URL')}") print(f" Relevance Score: {source.get(&#x27;relevance_score', 'N/A')}") print(f" Matching Indicators: {list(source.get(&#x27;indicators', {}).keys())}") print(f" Snippet: {source.get(&#x27;snippet', 'No snippet')[:150]}...\n") # Now access the most promising sources "keyword">for ScienceDirect Reference Works data print("=== ACCESSING TOP SOURCES FOR REFERENCE WORKS DATA ===\n") "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import re # Set up headers "keyword">for web requests headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', &#x27;Connection': 'keep-alive' } accessed_sources = [] # Focus on the top 3 most relevant sources "keyword">for i, source "keyword">in enumerate(top_sources[:3], 1): url = source.get(&#x27;url', '') title = source.get(&#x27;title', f'Source {i}') print(f"\nAccessing Source {i}: {title}") print(f"URL: {url}") print(f"Relevance Score: {source.get(&#x27;relevance_score', 'N/A')}") print(f"Target Indicators: {list(source.get(&#x27;indicators', {}).keys())}") "keyword">try: response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=30) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: print(f"✓ Successfully accessed (Status: {response.status_code})") print(f"Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes") # Check "keyword">if this "keyword">is a PDF file content_type = response.headers.get(&#x27;content-type', '').lower() "keyword">if &#x27;pdf' "keyword">in content_type "keyword">or url.lower().endswith('.pdf'): print(f"📄 PDF file detected - saving "keyword">for analysis") # Save PDF file pdf_filename = f"sciencedirect_source_{i}_{title.replace(&#x27; ', '_').replace('/', '_')[:50]}.pdf" pdf_filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, pdf_filename) "keyword">with open(pdf_filepath, &#x27;wb') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.content) print(f"PDF saved to: {pdf_filename}") accessed_sources.append({ &#x27;source_number': i, &#x27;title': title, &#x27;url': url, &#x27;status': 'success_pdf', &#x27;filename': pdf_filename, &#x27;content_type': 'pdf', &#x27;file_size': len(response.content), &#x27;relevance_score': source.get('relevance_score', 0) }) "keyword">else: print(f"🌐 HTML/Web page detected - parsing content") # Parse HTML content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Remove script "keyword">and style elements "keyword">for script "keyword">in soup(["script", "style"]): script.decompose() # Get text content text = soup.get_text() # Clean up text lines = (line.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in text.splitlines()) chunks = (phrase.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines "keyword">for phrase "keyword">in line.split(" ")) clean_text = &#x27; '.join(chunk "keyword">for chunk "keyword">in chunks "keyword">if chunk) # Save the content filename = f"sciencedirect_source_{i}_{title.replace(&#x27; ', '_').replace('/', '_')[:50]}.txt" filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) "keyword">with open(filepath, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f"Source: {title}\n") f.write(f"URL: {url}\n") f.write(f"Relevance Score: {source.get(&#x27;relevance_score', 'N/A')}\n") f.write(f"Target Indicators: {list(source.get(&#x27;indicators', {}).keys())}\n") f.write(f"Accessed: {response.status_code}\n") f.write(f"Content Length: {len(clean_text):,} characters\n") f.write("=" * 50 + "\n") f.write(clean_text) print(f"Content saved to: {filename}") print(f"Text length: {len(clean_text):,} characters") # Look "keyword">for key terms related to Reference Works "keyword">and statistical data key_terms = { &#x27;reference_works': ['reference works', 'reference work', 'major reference works'], &#x27;life_sciences': ['life sciences', 'life science', 'biological sciences'], &#x27;health_sciences': ['health sciences', 'health science', 'medical sciences'], &#x27;statistics': ['statistics', 'statistical', 'standard deviation', 'sample', 'variance'], &#x27;domains': ['domain', 'domains', 'category', 'categories', 'field', 'fields'], &#x27;year_2022': ['2022'], &#x27;distribution': ['distribution', 'distributed', 'breakdown'], &#x27;metrics': ['metrics', 'measurement', 'data', 'analysis'] } found_terms = {} content_lower = clean_text.lower() "keyword">for category, terms "keyword">in key_terms.items(): found_terms[category] = [] "keyword">for term "keyword">in terms: "keyword">if term "keyword">in content_lower: found_terms[category].append(term) # Look "keyword">for numerical data that might indicate statistical information number_patterns = { &#x27;percentages': re.findall(r'\b\d{1,3}(?:\.\d{1,2})?%', clean_text), &#x27;counts': re.findall(r'\b\d{1,6}\s+(?:reference works?|articles?|publications?|titles?)', content_lower), &#x27;statistical_values': re.findall(r'(?:standard deviation|std dev|variance)\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;sample_sizes': re.findall(r'(?:sample size|n\s*=|total)\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+)', content_lower) } print(f"Key terms found:") "keyword">for category, terms "keyword">in found_terms.items(): "keyword">if terms: print(f" {category}: {terms[:3]}") print(f"Numerical patterns found:") "keyword">for pattern_type, matches "keyword">in number_patterns.items(): "keyword">if matches: print(f" {pattern_type}: {matches[:5]}") accessed_sources.append({ &#x27;source_number': i, &#x27;title': title, &#x27;url': url, &#x27;status': 'success_html', &#x27;filename': filename, &#x27;content_type': 'html', &#x27;content_length': len(clean_text), &#x27;key_terms_found': {k: v "keyword">for k, v "keyword">in found_terms.items() "keyword">if v}, &#x27;numerical_patterns': {k: v "keyword">for k, v "keyword">in number_patterns.items() "keyword">if v}, &#x27;relevance_score': source.get('relevance_score', 0) }) "keyword">else: print(f"✗ Failed to access (Status: {response.status_code})") accessed_sources.append({ &#x27;source_number': i, &#x27;title': title, &#x27;url': url, &#x27;status': f'failed_{response.status_code}', &#x27;error': f'HTTP {response.status_code}' }) "keyword">except requests.exceptions.RequestException "keyword">as e: print(f"✗ Request failed: {e}") accessed_sources.append({ &#x27;source_number': i, &#x27;title': title, &#x27;url': url, &#x27;status': 'error', &#x27;error': str(e) }) print("-" * 70) # Save access results access_results = { &#x27;search_target': 'ScienceDirect Reference Works data by academic domains', &#x27;focus_areas': ['Life Sciences', 'Health Sciences'], &#x27;target_year': '2022', &#x27;target_statistics': 'sample standard deviations "keyword">for Reference Works distribution', &#x27;sources_accessed': len(accessed_sources), &#x27;successful_accesses': len([s "keyword">for s "keyword">in accessed_sources "keyword">if 'success' "keyword">in s.get('status', '')]), &#x27;failed_accesses': len([s "keyword">for s "keyword">in accessed_sources "keyword">if 'success' "keyword">not "keyword">in s.get('status', '')]), &#x27;pdf_files_downloaded': len([s "keyword">for s "keyword">in accessed_sources "keyword">if s.get('content_type') == 'pdf']), &#x27;html_pages_processed': len([s "keyword">for s "keyword">in accessed_sources "keyword">if s.get('content_type') == 'html']), &#x27;access_details': accessed_sources } results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;sciencedirect_source_access_results.json') "keyword">with open(results_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(access_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== ACCESS RESULTS SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"Sources accessed: {len(accessed_sources)}") print(f"Successful accesses: {access_results[&#x27;successful_accesses']}") print(f"Failed accesses: {access_results[&#x27;failed_accesses']}") print(f"PDF files downloaded: {access_results[&#x27;pdf_files_downloaded']}") print(f"HTML pages processed: {access_results[&#x27;html_pages_processed']}") print(f"Access results saved to: {os.path.basename(results_file)}") # Analyze findings "keyword">for statistical data statistical_findings = [] "keyword">for source "keyword">in accessed_sources: "keyword">if source.get(&#x27;status', '').startswith('success'): "keyword">if source.get(&#x27;numerical_patterns'): statistical_findings.append({ &#x27;source': source['title'], &#x27;url': source['url'], &#x27;patterns': source['numerical_patterns'] }) "keyword">if statistical_findings: print(f"\n=== STATISTICAL DATA FINDINGS ===\n") "keyword">for finding "keyword">in statistical_findings: print(f"Source: {finding[&#x27;source']}") print(f"URL: {finding[&#x27;url']}") print(f"Statistical patterns found:") "keyword">for pattern_type, values "keyword">in finding[&#x27;patterns'].items(): print(f" {pattern_type}: {values}") print() "keyword">else: print(f"\n⚠️ No statistical data patterns found "keyword">in accessed sources") print(f"Next step: Analyze downloaded PDF files "keyword">for detailed statistical information") "keyword">else: print(f"No promising sources found "keyword">or invalid data structure") "keyword">else: print(f"Promising sources file "keyword">not found: {promising_sources_file}") print(f"Available files: {os.listdir(workspace_dir)}") print(f"\n=== CURRENT WORKSPACE FILES ===\n") "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") print(f"\nNext step: Analyze downloaded content (especially PDF files) "keyword">for specific") print(f"statistical data about ScienceDirect Reference Works distribution across") print(f"Life Sciences "keyword">and Health Sciences domains "keyword">with sample standard deviations.")
📄 Output

"keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0] print(f"Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") "keyword">else: workspace_dir = &#x27;workspace' print(f"Using default workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") print(f"\nFiles "keyword">in workspace:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # Let's inspect the promising sources file structure first promising_sources_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;promising_sciencedirect_sources.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(promising_sources_file): print(f"\n=== INSPECTING PROMISING SOURCES FILE STRUCTURE ===\n") # Read first 500 characters to understand structure "keyword">with open(promising_sources_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: sample_content = f.read(500) print("First 500 characters of promising sources file:") print(sample_content) print("...\n") # Load "keyword">and examine the structure "keyword">with open(promising_sources_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: promising_sources = json.load(f) print(f"Promising sources file structure:") print(f" Data type: {type(promising_sources)}") "keyword">if isinstance(promising_sources, list): print(f" List "keyword">with {len(promising_sources)} items") "keyword">if promising_sources: print(f" Sample item keys: {list(promising_sources[0].keys())}") "keyword">elif isinstance(promising_sources, dict): print(f" Dictionary "keyword">with keys: {list(promising_sources.keys())}") # Display the most promising sources print(f"\n=== TOP PROMISING SCIENCEDIRECT SOURCES ===\n") "keyword">if isinstance(promising_sources, list) "keyword">and promising_sources: top_sources = promising_sources[:5] # Get top 5 sources "keyword">for i, source "keyword">in enumerate(top_sources, 1): print(f"{i}. {source.get(&#x27;title', 'No title')}") print(f" URL: {source.get(&#x27;url', 'No URL')}") print(f" Relevance Score: {source.get(&#x27;relevance_score', 'N/A')}") print(f" Matching Indicators: {list(source.get(&#x27;indicators', {}).keys())}") print(f" Snippet: {source.get(&#x27;snippet', 'No snippet')[:150]}...\n") # Now access the most promising sources "keyword">for ScienceDirect Reference Works data print("=== ACCESSING TOP SOURCES FOR REFERENCE WORKS DATA ===\n") "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import re # Set up headers "keyword">for web requests headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', &#x27;Connection': 'keep-alive' } accessed_sources = [] # Focus on the top 3 most relevant sources "keyword">for i, source "keyword">in enumerate(top_sources[:3], 1): url = source.get(&#x27;url', '') title = source.get(&#x27;title', f'Source {i}') print(f"\nAccessing Source {i}: {title}") print(f"URL: {url}") print(f"Relevance Score: {source.get(&#x27;relevance_score', 'N/A')}") print(f"Target Indicators: {list(source.get(&#x27;indicators', {}).keys())}") "keyword">try: response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=30) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: print(f"✓ Successfully accessed (Status: {response.status_code})") print(f"Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes") # Check "keyword">if this "keyword">is a PDF file content_type = response.headers.get(&#x27;content-type', '').lower() "keyword">if &#x27;pdf' "keyword">in content_type "keyword">or url.lower().endswith('.pdf'): print(f"📄 PDF file detected - saving "keyword">for analysis") # Save PDF file pdf_filename = f"sciencedirect_source_{i}_{title.replace(&#x27; ', '_').replace('/', '_')[:50]}.pdf" pdf_filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, pdf_filename) "keyword">with open(pdf_filepath, &#x27;wb') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.content) print(f"PDF saved to: {pdf_filename}") accessed_sources.append({ &#x27;source_number': i, &#x27;title': title, &#x27;url': url, &#x27;status': 'success_pdf', &#x27;filename': pdf_filename, &#x27;content_type': 'pdf', &#x27;file_size': len(response.content), &#x27;relevance_score': source.get('relevance_score', 0) }) "keyword">else: print(f"🌐 HTML/Web page detected - parsing content") # Parse HTML content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Remove script "keyword">and style elements "keyword">for script "keyword">in soup(["script", "style"]): script.decompose() # Get text content text = soup.get_text() # Clean up text lines = (line.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in text.splitlines()) chunks = (phrase.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines "keyword">for phrase "keyword">in line.split(" ")) clean_text = &#x27; '.join(chunk "keyword">for chunk "keyword">in chunks "keyword">if chunk) # Save the content filename = f"sciencedirect_source_{i}_{title.replace(&#x27; ', '_').replace('/', '_')[:50]}.txt" filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) "keyword">with open(filepath, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f"Source: {title}\n") f.write(f"URL: {url}\n") f.write(f"Relevance Score: {source.get(&#x27;relevance_score', 'N/A')}\n") f.write(f"Target Indicators: {list(source.get(&#x27;indicators', {}).keys())}\n") f.write(f"Accessed: {response.status_code}\n") f.write(f"Content Length: {len(clean_text):,} characters\n") f.write("=" * 50 + "\n") f.write(clean_text) print(f"Content saved to: {filename}") print(f"Text length: {len(clean_text):,} characters") # Look "keyword">for key terms related to Reference Works "keyword">and statistical data key_terms = { &#x27;reference_works': ['reference works', 'reference work', 'major reference works'], &#x27;life_sciences': ['life sciences', 'life science', 'biological sciences'], &#x27;health_sciences': ['health sciences', 'health science', 'medical sciences'], &#x27;statistics': ['statistics', 'statistical', 'standard deviation', 'sample', 'variance'], &#x27;domains': ['domain', 'domains', 'category', 'categories', 'field', 'fields'], &#x27;year_2022': ['2022'], &#x27;distribution': ['distribution', 'distributed', 'breakdown'], &#x27;metrics': ['metrics', 'measurement', 'data', 'analysis'] } found_terms = {} content_lower = clean_text.lower() "keyword">for category, terms "keyword">in key_terms.items(): found_terms[category] = [] "keyword">for term "keyword">in terms: "keyword">if term "keyword">in content_lower: found_terms[category].append(term) # Look "keyword">for numerical data that might indicate statistical information number_patterns = { &#x27;percentages': re.findall(r'\b\d{1,3}(?:\.\d{1,2})?%', clean_text), &#x27;counts': re.findall(r'\b\d{1,6}\s+(?:reference works?|articles?|publications?|titles?)', content_lower), &#x27;statistical_values': re.findall(r'(?:standard deviation|std dev|variance)\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;sample_sizes': re.findall(r'(?:sample size|n\s*=|total)\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+)', content_lower) } print(f"Key terms found:") "keyword">for category, terms "keyword">in found_terms.items(): "keyword">if terms: print(f" {category}: {terms[:3]}") print(f"Numerical patterns found:") "keyword">for pattern_type, matches "keyword">in number_patterns.items(): "keyword">if matches: print(f" {pattern_type}: {matches[:5]}") accessed_sources.append({ &#x27;source_number': i, &#x27;title': title, &#x27;url': url, &#x27;status': 'success_html', &#x27;filename': filename, &#x27;content_type': 'html', &#x27;content_length': len(clean_text), &#x27;key_terms_found': {k: v "keyword">for k, v "keyword">in found_terms.items() "keyword">if v}, &#x27;numerical_patterns': {k: v "keyword">for k, v "keyword">in number_patterns.items() "keyword">if v}, &#x27;relevance_score': source.get('relevance_score', 0) }) "keyword">else: print(f"✗ Failed to access (Status: {response.status_code})") accessed_sources.append({ &#x27;source_number': i, &#x27;title': title, &#x27;url': url, &#x27;status': f'failed_{response.status_code}', &#x27;error': f'HTTP {response.status_code}' }) "keyword">except requests.exceptions.RequestException "keyword">as e: print(f"✗ Request failed: {e}") accessed_sources.append({ &#x27;source_number': i, &#x27;title': title, &#x27;url': url, &#x27;status': 'error', &#x27;error': str(e) }) print("-" * 70) # Save access results access_results = { &#x27;search_target': 'ScienceDirect Reference Works data by academic domains', &#x27;focus_areas': ['Life Sciences', 'Health Sciences'], &#x27;target_year': '2022', &#x27;target_statistics': 'sample standard deviations "keyword">for Reference Works distribution', &#x27;sources_accessed': len(accessed_sources), &#x27;successful_accesses': len([s "keyword">for s "keyword">in accessed_sources "keyword">if 'success' "keyword">in s.get('status', '')]), &#x27;failed_accesses': len([s "keyword">for s "keyword">in accessed_sources "keyword">if 'success' "keyword">not "keyword">in s.get('status', '')]), &#x27;pdf_files_downloaded': len([s "keyword">for s "keyword">in accessed_sources "keyword">if s.get('content_type') == 'pdf']), &#x27;html_pages_processed': len([s "keyword">for s "keyword">in accessed_sources "keyword">if s.get('content_type') == 'html']), &#x27;access_details': accessed_sources } results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;sciencedirect_source_access_results.json') "keyword">with open(results_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(access_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== ACCESS RESULTS SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"Sources accessed: {len(accessed_sources)}") print(f"Successful accesses: {access_results[&#x27;successful_accesses']}") print(f"Failed accesses: {access_results[&#x27;failed_accesses']}") print(f"PDF files downloaded: {access_results[&#x27;pdf_files_downloaded']}") print(f"HTML pages processed: {access_results[&#x27;html_pages_processed']}") print(f"Access results saved to: {os.path.basename(results_file)}") # Analyze findings "keyword">for statistical data statistical_findings = [] "keyword">for source "keyword">in accessed_sources: "keyword">if source.get(&#x27;status', '').startswith('success'): "keyword">if source.get(&#x27;numerical_patterns'): statistical_findings.append({ &#x27;source': source['title'], &#x27;url': source['url'], &#x27;patterns': source['numerical_patterns'] }) "keyword">if statistical_findings: print(f"\n=== STATISTICAL DATA FINDINGS ===\n") "keyword">for finding "keyword">in statistical_findings: print(f"Source: {finding[&#x27;source']}") print(f"URL: {finding[&#x27;url']}") print(f"Statistical patterns found:") "keyword">for pattern_type, values "keyword">in finding[&#x27;patterns'].items(): print(f" {pattern_type}: {values}") print() "keyword">else: print(f"\n⚠️ No statistical data patterns found "keyword">in accessed sources") print(f"Next step: Analyze downloaded PDF files "keyword">for detailed statistical information") "keyword">else: print(f"No promising sources found "keyword">or invalid data structure") "keyword">else: print(f"Promising sources file "keyword">not found: {promising_sources_file}") print(f"Available files: {os.listdir(workspace_dir)}") print(f"\n=== CURRENT WORKSPACE FILES ===\n") "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") print(f"\nNext step: Analyze downloaded content (especially PDF files) "keyword">for specific") print(f"statistical data about ScienceDirect Reference Works distribution across") print(f"Life Sciences "keyword">and Health Sciences domains "keyword">with sample standard deviations.")

developer Code Execution - Plan 01 (Iteration 3)

📝 Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import re print("=== ANALYZING DOWNLOADED SCIENCEDIRECT SOURCES FOR REFERENCE WORKS DATA ===\n") # Find the correct workspace directory workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0] print(f"Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") "keyword">else: print("No workspace directory found.") exit() print(f"\nCurrent files "keyword">in workspace:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # First, let's properly inspect the promising sources file promising_sources_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;promising_sciencedirect_sources.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(promising_sources_file): print(f"\n=== LOADING PROMISING SOURCES FOR PROPER ANALYSIS ===\n") "keyword">with open(promising_sources_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: promising_sources = json.load(f) print(f"Found {len(promising_sources)} promising sources") # Get the top 5 most relevant sources top_sources = promising_sources[:5] print(f"\n=== TOP 5 SOURCES TO ANALYZE ===\n") "keyword">for i, source "keyword">in enumerate(top_sources, 1): print(f"{i}. {source[&#x27;title']}") print(f" URL: {source[&#x27;url']}") print(f" Relevance Score: {source[&#x27;relevance_score']}") print(f" Key Indicators: {list(source[&#x27;indicators'].keys())}") print(f" Snippet: {source[&#x27;snippet'][:100]}...\n") # Now let's properly access these sources, focusing on the statistical data print("=== ACCESSING SOURCES FOR REFERENCE WORKS STATISTICAL DATA ===\n") headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', &#x27;Connection': 'keep-alive' } statistical_data_found = [] "keyword">for i, source "keyword">in enumerate(top_sources[:3], 1): # Focus on top 3 url = source[&#x27;url'] title = source[&#x27;title'] print(f"\n--- Accessing Source {i}: {title} ---") print(f"URL: {url}") print(f"Expected content: Reference Works data "keyword">for Life Sciences "keyword">and Health Sciences") "keyword">try: response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=30) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: print(f"✓ Successfully accessed (Status: {response.status_code})") print(f"Content-Type: {response.headers.get(&#x27;content-type', 'Unknown')}") print(f"Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes") # Check "keyword">if it's a PDF "keyword">if &#x27;pdf' "keyword">in response.headers.get('content-type', '').lower() "keyword">or url.lower().endswith('.pdf'): print(f"📄 PDF file detected - saving "keyword">for text analysis") # Save PDF pdf_filename = f"reference_works_source_{i}.pdf" pdf_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, pdf_filename) "keyword">with open(pdf_path, &#x27;wb') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.content) print(f"PDF saved to: {pdf_filename}") print(f"Note: PDF contains potential Reference Works statistical data") # Try to extract some basic info "keyword">from PDF metadata "keyword">or first few bytes pdf_info = { &#x27;filename': pdf_filename, &#x27;size_bytes': len(response.content), &#x27;url': url, &#x27;title': title, &#x27;content_type': 'pdf', &#x27;relevance_score': source['relevance_score'] } statistical_data_found.append(pdf_info) "keyword">else: print(f"🌐 Web page detected - parsing HTML content") # Parse HTML content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Remove script "keyword">and style elements "keyword">for script "keyword">in soup(["script", "style"]): script.decompose() # Get clean text text = soup.get_text() lines = (line.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in text.splitlines()) chunks = (phrase.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines "keyword">for phrase "keyword">in line.split(" ")) clean_text = &#x27; '.join(chunk "keyword">for chunk "keyword">in chunks "keyword">if chunk) # Save the content text_filename = f"reference_works_source_{i}.txt" text_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, text_filename) "keyword">with open(text_path, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f"Source: {title}\n") f.write(f"URL: {url}\n") f.write(f"Relevance Score: {source[&#x27;relevance_score']}\n") f.write(f"Content Length: {len(clean_text):,} characters\n") f.write("=" * 60 + "\n") f.write(clean_text) print(f"Content saved to: {text_filename}") print(f"Text length: {len(clean_text):,} characters") # Search "keyword">for Reference Works statistical data content_lower = clean_text.lower() # Look "keyword">for key statistical terms statistical_patterns = { &#x27;reference_works_counts': re.findall(r'(\d{1,5})\s+(?:reference works?|major reference works?)', content_lower), &#x27;life_sciences_data': re.findall(r'life sciences?[^.]*?(\d{1,4})', content_lower), &#x27;health_sciences_data': re.findall(r'health sciences?[^.]*?(\d{1,4})', content_lower), &#x27;standard_deviations': re.findall(r'(?:standard deviation|std\.?\s*dev\.?|σ)\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;sample_statistics': re.findall(r'(?:sample|n)\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+)', content_lower), &#x27;domain_distributions': re.findall(r'(?:domain|field|category)\s+[^.]*?(\d{1,4})', content_lower), &#x27;year_2022_data': re.findall(r'2022[^.]*?(\d{1,4})', content_lower) } # Look "keyword">for specific ScienceDirect Reference Works mentions sciencedirect_mentions = { &#x27;reference_works_mentions': content_lower.count('reference works'), &#x27;major_reference_works': content_lower.count('major reference works'), &#x27;sciencedirect_mentions': content_lower.count('sciencedirect'), &#x27;life_sciences_mentions': content_lower.count('life sciences'), &#x27;health_sciences_mentions': content_lower.count('health sciences'), &#x27;statistics_mentions': content_lower.count('statistics') + content_lower.count('statistical') } print(f"\n📊 Statistical patterns found:") "keyword">for pattern_name, matches "keyword">in statistical_patterns.items(): "keyword">if matches: print(f" {pattern_name}: {matches[:5]}") print(f"\n📈 Content analysis:") "keyword">for mention_type, count "keyword">in sciencedirect_mentions.items(): "keyword">if count > 0: print(f" {mention_type}: {count} mentions") # Look "keyword">for tables "keyword">or structured data tables = soup.find_all(&#x27;table') "keyword">if tables: print(f"\n📋 Found {len(tables)} tables - potential statistical data") # Save analysis results analysis_data = { &#x27;filename': text_filename, &#x27;url': url, &#x27;title': title, &#x27;content_type': 'html', &#x27;text_length': len(clean_text), &#x27;statistical_patterns': {k: v "keyword">for k, v "keyword">in statistical_patterns.items() "keyword">if v}, &#x27;content_mentions': sciencedirect_mentions, &#x27;tables_found': len(tables), &#x27;relevance_score': source['relevance_score'] } statistical_data_found.append(analysis_data) "keyword">else: print(f"✗ Failed to access (Status: {response.status_code})") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"✗ Error accessing source: {e}") print("-" * 70) # Save comprehensive analysis results final_analysis = { &#x27;search_objective': 'ScienceDirect Reference Works statistical data by academic domains', &#x27;target_domains': ['Life Sciences', 'Health Sciences'], &#x27;target_year': '2022', &#x27;target_statistics': 'sample standard deviations "keyword">for Reference Works distribution', &#x27;sources_analyzed': len(statistical_data_found), &#x27;pdf_files_downloaded': len([s "keyword">for s "keyword">in statistical_data_found "keyword">if s.get('content_type') == 'pdf']), &#x27;html_pages_analyzed': len([s "keyword">for s "keyword">in statistical_data_found "keyword">if s.get('content_type') == 'html']), &#x27;statistical_findings': statistical_data_found } analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;reference_works_statistical_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_analysis, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS RESULTS ===\n") print(f"Sources analyzed: {final_analysis[&#x27;sources_analyzed']}") print(f"PDF files downloaded: {final_analysis[&#x27;pdf_files_downloaded']}") print(f"HTML pages analyzed: {final_analysis[&#x27;html_pages_analyzed']}") print(f"Analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}") # Summary of findings print(f"\n=== STATISTICAL DATA FINDINGS SUMMARY ===\n") statistical_evidence = [] "keyword">for finding "keyword">in statistical_data_found: "keyword">if finding.get(&#x27;statistical_patterns'): statistical_evidence.append(finding) "keyword">if statistical_evidence: print(f"✓ Found {len(statistical_evidence)} sources "keyword">with statistical patterns") "keyword">for evidence "keyword">in statistical_evidence: print(f"\nSource: {evidence[&#x27;title']}") print(f"Statistical patterns: {list(evidence[&#x27;statistical_patterns'].keys())}") "keyword">for pattern, values "keyword">in evidence[&#x27;statistical_patterns'].items(): print(f" {pattern}: {values}") "keyword">else: print(f"⚠️ No clear statistical patterns found "keyword">in HTML sources") print(f"📄 PDF files downloaded may contain the target statistical data") print(f"Next step: Extract "keyword">and analyze PDF content "keyword">for Reference Works statistics") # Check "keyword">for PDF files that need further analysis pdf_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in statistical_data_found "keyword">if f.get(&#x27;content_type') == 'pdf'] "keyword">if pdf_files: print(f"\n=== PDF FILES REQUIRING ANALYSIS ===\n") "keyword">for pdf "keyword">in pdf_files: print(f"📄 {pdf[&#x27;filename']} ({pdf['size_bytes']:,} bytes)") print(f" Source: {pdf[&#x27;title']}") print(f" Relevance Score: {pdf[&#x27;relevance_score']}") print(f" Expected content: Reference Works statistical data "keyword">for 2022") print(f"\nRecommendation: These PDF files likely contain the target statistical data") print(f"about ScienceDirect Reference Works distribution across Life Sciences") print(f""keyword">and Health Sciences domains "keyword">with sample standard deviations.") "keyword">else: print(f"Promising sources file "keyword">not found: {promising_sources_file}") print(f"\n=== FINAL WORKSPACE STATUS ===\n") "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")
📄 Output

2025-08-11 06:24:22

"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import re print("=== ANALYZING DOWNLOADED SCIENCEDIRECT SOURCES FOR REFERENCE WORKS DATA ===\n") # Find the correct workspace directory workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0] print(f"Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") "keyword">else: print("No workspace directory found.") exit() print(f"\nCurrent files "keyword">in workspace:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # First, let's properly inspect the promising sources file promising_sources_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;promising_sciencedirect_sources.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(promising_sources_file): print(f"\n=== LOADING PROMISING SOURCES FOR PROPER ANALYSIS ===\n") "keyword">with open(promising_sources_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: promising_sources = json.load(f) print(f"Found {len(promising_sources)} promising sources") # Get the top 5 most relevant sources top_sources = promising_sources[:5] print(f"\n=== TOP 5 SOURCES TO ANALYZE ===\n") "keyword">for i, source "keyword">in enumerate(top_sources, 1): print(f"{i}. {source[&#x27;title']}") print(f" URL: {source[&#x27;url']}") print(f" Relevance Score: {source[&#x27;relevance_score']}") print(f" Key Indicators: {list(source[&#x27;indicators'].keys())}") print(f" Snippet: {source[&#x27;snippet'][:100]}...\n") # Now let's properly access these sources, focusing on the statistical data print("=== ACCESSING SOURCES FOR REFERENCE WORKS STATISTICAL DATA ===\n") headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', &#x27;Connection': 'keep-alive' } statistical_data_found = [] "keyword">for i, source "keyword">in enumerate(top_sources[:3], 1): # Focus on top 3 url = source[&#x27;url'] title = source[&#x27;title'] print(f"\n--- Accessing Source {i}: {title} ---") print(f"URL: {url}") print(f"Expected content: Reference Works data "keyword">for Life Sciences "keyword">and Health Sciences") "keyword">try: response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=30) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: print(f"✓ Successfully accessed (Status: {response.status_code})") print(f"Content-Type: {response.headers.get(&#x27;content-type', 'Unknown')}") print(f"Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes") # Check "keyword">if it's a PDF "keyword">if &#x27;pdf' "keyword">in response.headers.get('content-type', '').lower() "keyword">or url.lower().endswith('.pdf'): print(f"📄 PDF file detected - saving "keyword">for text analysis") # Save PDF pdf_filename = f"reference_works_source_{i}.pdf" pdf_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, pdf_filename) "keyword">with open(pdf_path, &#x27;wb') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.content) print(f"PDF saved to: {pdf_filename}") print(f"Note: PDF contains potential Reference Works statistical data") # Try to extract some basic info "keyword">from PDF metadata "keyword">or first few bytes pdf_info = { &#x27;filename': pdf_filename, &#x27;size_bytes': len(response.content), &#x27;url': url, &#x27;title': title, &#x27;content_type': 'pdf', &#x27;relevance_score': source['relevance_score'] } statistical_data_found.append(pdf_info) "keyword">else: print(f"🌐 Web page detected - parsing HTML content") # Parse HTML content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Remove script "keyword">and style elements "keyword">for script "keyword">in soup(["script", "style"]): script.decompose() # Get clean text text = soup.get_text() lines = (line.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in text.splitlines()) chunks = (phrase.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines "keyword">for phrase "keyword">in line.split(" ")) clean_text = &#x27; '.join(chunk "keyword">for chunk "keyword">in chunks "keyword">if chunk) # Save the content text_filename = f"reference_works_source_{i}.txt" text_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, text_filename) "keyword">with open(text_path, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f"Source: {title}\n") f.write(f"URL: {url}\n") f.write(f"Relevance Score: {source[&#x27;relevance_score']}\n") f.write(f"Content Length: {len(clean_text):,} characters\n") f.write("=" * 60 + "\n") f.write(clean_text) print(f"Content saved to: {text_filename}") print(f"Text length: {len(clean_text):,} characters") # Search "keyword">for Reference Works statistical data content_lower = clean_text.lower() # Look "keyword">for key statistical terms statistical_patterns = { &#x27;reference_works_counts': re.findall(r'(\d{1,5})\s+(?:reference works?|major reference works?)', content_lower), &#x27;life_sciences_data': re.findall(r'life sciences?[^.]*?(\d{1,4})', content_lower), &#x27;health_sciences_data': re.findall(r'health sciences?[^.]*?(\d{1,4})', content_lower), &#x27;standard_deviations': re.findall(r'(?:standard deviation|std\.?\s*dev\.?|σ)\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;sample_statistics': re.findall(r'(?:sample|n)\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+)', content_lower), &#x27;domain_distributions': re.findall(r'(?:domain|field|category)\s+[^.]*?(\d{1,4})', content_lower), &#x27;year_2022_data': re.findall(r'2022[^.]*?(\d{1,4})', content_lower) } # Look "keyword">for specific ScienceDirect Reference Works mentions sciencedirect_mentions = { &#x27;reference_works_mentions': content_lower.count('reference works'), &#x27;major_reference_works': content_lower.count('major reference works'), &#x27;sciencedirect_mentions': content_lower.count('sciencedirect'), &#x27;life_sciences_mentions': content_lower.count('life sciences'), &#x27;health_sciences_mentions': content_lower.count('health sciences'), &#x27;statistics_mentions': content_lower.count('statistics') + content_lower.count('statistical') } print(f"\n📊 Statistical patterns found:") "keyword">for pattern_name, matches "keyword">in statistical_patterns.items(): "keyword">if matches: print(f" {pattern_name}: {matches[:5]}") print(f"\n📈 Content analysis:") "keyword">for mention_type, count "keyword">in sciencedirect_mentions.items(): "keyword">if count > 0: print(f" {mention_type}: {count} mentions") # Look "keyword">for tables "keyword">or structured data tables = soup.find_all(&#x27;table') "keyword">if tables: print(f"\n📋 Found {len(tables)} tables - potential statistical data") # Save analysis results analysis_data = { &#x27;filename': text_filename, &#x27;url': url, &#x27;title': title, &#x27;content_type': 'html', &#x27;text_length': len(clean_text), &#x27;statistical_patterns': {k: v "keyword">for k, v "keyword">in statistical_patterns.items() "keyword">if v}, &#x27;content_mentions': sciencedirect_mentions, &#x27;tables_found': len(tables), &#x27;relevance_score': source['relevance_score'] } statistical_data_found.append(analysis_data) "keyword">else: print(f"✗ Failed to access (Status: {response.status_code})") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"✗ Error accessing source: {e}") print("-" * 70) # Save comprehensive analysis results final_analysis = { &#x27;search_objective': 'ScienceDirect Reference Works statistical data by academic domains', &#x27;target_domains': ['Life Sciences', 'Health Sciences'], &#x27;target_year': '2022', &#x27;target_statistics': 'sample standard deviations "keyword">for Reference Works distribution', &#x27;sources_analyzed': len(statistical_data_found), &#x27;pdf_files_downloaded': len([s "keyword">for s "keyword">in statistical_data_found "keyword">if s.get('content_type') == 'pdf']), &#x27;html_pages_analyzed': len([s "keyword">for s "keyword">in statistical_data_found "keyword">if s.get('content_type') == 'html']), &#x27;statistical_findings': statistical_data_found } analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;reference_works_statistical_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_analysis, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS RESULTS ===\n") print(f"Sources analyzed: {final_analysis[&#x27;sources_analyzed']}") print(f"PDF files downloaded: {final_analysis[&#x27;pdf_files_downloaded']}") print(f"HTML pages analyzed: {final_analysis[&#x27;html_pages_analyzed']}") print(f"Analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}") # developer Code Execution - Plan 01 (Iteration 4)
2025-08-11 06:25:46

📝 Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import re print("=== FOCUSED ANALYSIS: SCIENCEDIRECT REFERENCE WORKS STATISTICAL DATA ===\n") # Find workspace directory workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0] print(f"Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") "keyword">else: print("No workspace directory found.") exit() print(f"\nInspecting workspace files:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # First, let's properly inspect the promising sources file structure promising_sources_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;promising_sciencedirect_sources.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(promising_sources_file): print(f"\n=== INSPECTING PROMISING SOURCES FILE STRUCTURE ===\n") # Read first 200 characters to understand structure "keyword">with open(promising_sources_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: sample_content = f.read(200) print("First 200 characters:") print(sample_content) print("...\n") # Load "keyword">and examine structure safely "keyword">with open(promising_sources_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: data = json.load(f) print(f"Data type: {type(data)}") "keyword">if isinstance(data, list): print(f"List "keyword">with {len(data)} items") "keyword">if data: print(f"First item keys: {list(data[0].keys())}") print(f"First item structure:") "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in data[0].items(): print(f" {key}: {type(value)} - {str(value)[:50]}...") # Now focus on the most relevant sources "keyword">for Reference Works data print(f"\n=== ANALYZING TOP SOURCES FOR REFERENCE WORKS DATA ===\n") "keyword">if isinstance(data, list) "keyword">and data: # Sort by relevance score to get the best sources sorted_sources = sorted(data, key="keyword">lambda x: x.get(&#x27;relevance_score', 0), reverse="keyword">True) top_3_sources = sorted_sources[:3] print(f"Top 3 most relevant sources:") "keyword">for i, source "keyword">in enumerate(top_3_sources, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {source.get(&#x27;title', 'No title')}") print(f" URL: {source.get(&#x27;url', 'No URL')}") print(f" Relevance Score: {source.get(&#x27;relevance_score', 'N/A')}") print(f" Key Indicators: {list(source.get(&#x27;indicators', {}).keys())}") print(f" Snippet: {source.get(&#x27;snippet', 'No snippet')[:150]}...") # Check "keyword">if we already have downloaded content existing_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) pdf_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in existing_files "keyword">if f.endswith(&#x27;.pdf')] txt_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in existing_files "keyword">if f.startswith(&#x27;sciencedirect_source_') "keyword">and f.endswith('.txt')] print(f"\n=== EXISTING DOWNLOADED CONTENT ===\n") print(f"PDF files: {len(pdf_files)}") "keyword">for pdf "keyword">in pdf_files: pdf_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, pdf) pdf_size = os.path.getsize(pdf_path) print(f" - {pdf} ({pdf_size:,} bytes)") print(f"\nText files: {len(txt_files)}") "keyword">for txt "keyword">in txt_files: txt_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, txt) txt_size = os.path.getsize(txt_path) print(f" - {txt} ({txt_size:,} bytes)") # If we don't have enough content, access the top sources "keyword">if len(pdf_files) + len(txt_files) < 3: print(f"\n=== ACCESSING ADDITIONAL SOURCES FOR REFERENCE WORKS DATA ===\n") headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5' } "keyword">for i, source "keyword">in enumerate(top_3_sources, 1): url = source.get(&#x27;url', '') title = source.get(&#x27;title', f'Source {i}') # Skip "keyword">if we already have this content expected_filename = f"reference_works_analysis_{i}.txt" "keyword">if expected_filename "keyword">in existing_files: print(f"Skipping {title} - already downloaded") "keyword">continue print(f"\nAccessing: {title}") print(f"URL: {url}") "keyword">try: response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=30) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: print(f"✓ Successfully accessed ({response.status_code})") # Check content type content_type = response.headers.get(&#x27;content-type', '').lower() "keyword">if &#x27;pdf' "keyword">in content_type "keyword">or url.lower().endswith('.pdf'): print(f"📄 PDF file - saving "keyword">for analysis") pdf_filename = f"reference_works_analysis_{i}.pdf" pdf_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, pdf_filename) "keyword">with open(pdf_path, &#x27;wb') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.content) print(f"PDF saved: {pdf_filename} ({len(response.content):,} bytes)") "keyword">else: print(f"🌐 Web page - extracting content") soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Remove scripts "keyword">and styles "keyword">for element "keyword">in soup([&#x27;script', 'style']): element.decompose() # Extract text text = soup.get_text() lines = (line.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in text.splitlines()) clean_text = &#x27; '.join(line "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines "keyword">if line) # Save content txt_filename = f"reference_works_analysis_{i}.txt" txt_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, txt_filename) "keyword">with open(txt_path, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f"Source: {title}\n") f.write(f"URL: {url}\n") f.write(f"Relevance Score: {source.get(&#x27;relevance_score', 'N/A')}\n") f.write(f"Content Length: {len(clean_text):,} characters\n") f.write("=" * 60 + "\n") f.write(clean_text) print(f"Content saved: {txt_filename} ({len(clean_text):,} characters)") # Quick analysis "keyword">for Reference Works data content_lower = clean_text.lower() # Search "keyword">for statistical data patterns key_findings = { &#x27;reference_works_mentions': content_lower.count('reference works'), &#x27;major_reference_works': content_lower.count('major reference works'), &#x27;life_sciences_mentions': content_lower.count('life sciences'), &#x27;health_sciences_mentions': content_lower.count('health sciences'), &#x27;statistics_mentions': content_lower.count('statistics') + content_lower.count('statistical'), &#x27;standard_deviation_mentions': content_lower.count('standard deviation') + content_lower.count('std dev'), &#x27;year_2022_mentions': content_lower.count('2022') } # Look "keyword">for numerical patterns numbers_pattern = re.findall(r&#x27;\b\d{1,4}\b', clean_text) statistical_terms = re.findall(r&#x27;(?:standard deviation|variance|sample size|mean|median)\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower) print(f"Key findings:") "keyword">for key, count "keyword">in key_findings.items(): "keyword">if count > 0: print(f" {key}: {count}") "keyword">if statistical_terms: print(f" Statistical values found: {statistical_terms[:5]}") "keyword">else: print(f"✗ Failed to access ({response.status_code})") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"✗ Error: {e}") print("-" * 50) # Now analyze all available content "keyword">for Reference Works statistical data print(f"\n=== COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF ALL DOWNLOADED CONTENT ===\n") all_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) analysis_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in all_files "keyword">if (f.startswith(&#x27;reference_works_') "keyword">or f.startswith('sciencedirect_source_')) "keyword">and (f.endswith('.txt') "keyword">or f.endswith('.pdf'))] print(f"Files to analyze: {len(analysis_files)}") "keyword">for file "keyword">in analysis_files: file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # Analyze text files "keyword">for statistical data statistical_findings = [] "keyword">for file "keyword">in analysis_files: "keyword">if file.endswith(&#x27;.txt'): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) print(f"\nAnalyzing: {file}") "keyword">with open(file_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: content = f.read() content_lower = content.lower() # Search "keyword">for specific Reference Works statistical data patterns = { &#x27;reference_works_counts': re.findall(r'(\d{1,5})\s+(?:reference works?|major reference works?)', content_lower), &#x27;life_sciences_numbers': re.findall(r'life sciences?[^.]*?(\d{1,4})', content_lower), &#x27;health_sciences_numbers': re.findall(r'health sciences?[^.]*?(\d{1,4})', content_lower), &#x27;standard_deviations': re.findall(r'(?:standard deviation|std\.?\s*dev\.?|σ)\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;sample_statistics': re.findall(r'(?:sample|n)\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+)', content_lower), &#x27;domain_statistics': re.findall(r'(?:domain|field|category)\s+[^.]*?(\d{1,4})', content_lower), &#x27;year_2022_data': re.findall(r'2022[^.]*?(\d{1,4})', content_lower) } # Count key term mentions term_counts = { &#x27;reference_works': content_lower.count('reference works'), &#x27;major_reference_works': content_lower.count('major reference works'), &#x27;sciencedirect': content_lower.count('sciencedirect'), &#x27;life_sciences': content_lower.count('life sciences'), &#x27;health_sciences': content_lower.count('health sciences'), &#x27;statistics': content_lower.count('statistics') + content_lower.count('statistical'), &#x27;distribution': content_lower.count('distribution'), &#x27;2022': content_lower.count('2022') } findings = { &#x27;filename': file, &#x27;content_length': len(content), &#x27;statistical_patterns': {k: v "keyword">for k, v "keyword">in patterns.items() "keyword">if v}, &#x27;term_mentions': {k: v "keyword">for k, v "keyword">in term_counts.items() "keyword">if v > 0} } "keyword">if findings[&#x27;statistical_patterns'] "keyword">or findings['term_mentions']: statistical_findings.append(findings) print(f" ✓ Found relevant data:") "keyword">if findings[&#x27;statistical_patterns']: print(f" Statistical patterns: {list(findings[&#x27;statistical_patterns'].keys())}") "keyword">for pattern, values "keyword">in findings[&#x27;statistical_patterns'].items(): print(f" {pattern}: {values[:3]}") "keyword">if findings[&#x27;term_mentions']: print(f" Key terms: {findings[&#x27;term_mentions']}") "keyword">else: print(f" - No relevant statistical data found") # Save comprehensive analysis final_analysis = { &#x27;objective': 'ScienceDirect Reference Works statistical data by academic domains', &#x27;target_domains': ['Life Sciences', 'Health Sciences'], &#x27;target_year': '2022', &#x27;target_statistics': 'sample standard deviations "keyword">for Reference Works distribution', &#x27;files_analyzed': len(analysis_files), &#x27;text_files_with_data': len(statistical_findings), &#x27;pdf_files_downloaded': len([f "keyword">for f "keyword">in analysis_files "keyword">if f.endswith('.pdf')]), &#x27;statistical_findings': statistical_findings } results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;sciencedirect_reference_works_final_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(results_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_analysis, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== FINAL ANALYSIS SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"Files analyzed: {final_analysis[&#x27;files_analyzed']}") print(f"Text files "keyword">with relevant data: {final_analysis[&#x27;text_files_with_data']}") print(f"PDF files downloaded: {final_analysis[&#x27;pdf_files_downloaded']}") print(f"Analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(results_file)}") "keyword">if statistical_findings: print(f"\n✓ SUCCESS: Found Reference Works statistical data "keyword">in {len(statistical_findings)} sources") print(f"\nKey findings:") "keyword">for finding "keyword">in statistical_findings: print(f"\n📊 {finding[&#x27;filename']}:") "keyword">if finding.get(&#x27;statistical_patterns'): "keyword">for pattern, values "keyword">in finding[&#x27;statistical_patterns'].items(): print(f" {pattern}: {values}") "keyword">if finding.get(&#x27;term_mentions'): relevant_terms = {k: v "keyword">for k, v "keyword">in finding[&#x27;term_mentions'].items() "keyword">if k "keyword">in ['reference_works', 'life_sciences', 'health_sciences', 'statistics', '2022']} "keyword">if relevant_terms: print(f" Key term mentions: {relevant_terms}") "keyword">else: print(f"\n⚠️ Limited statistical data found "keyword">in text files") print(f"📄 PDF files may contain the detailed statistical data") print(f"Recommendation: Extract text "keyword">from PDF files "keyword">for complete analysis") "keyword">else: print(f"Invalid data structure "keyword">in promising sources file") "keyword">else: print(f"Promising sources file "keyword">not found: {promising_sources_file}") print(f"\n=== WORKSPACE STATUS ===\n") "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")

tester Code Testing
2025-08-11 06:25:46

Execution partially successful - The code ran without errors and successfully analyzed the workspace structure, identifying 67 promising ScienceDirect sources and downloading 3 PDF files totaling over 13MB each. The code properly accessed the top-ranked sources including the highly relevant 'ELSEVIER DATABASES USER TRAINING AND UPDATES' PDF with relevance score 5. However, there's a critical recurring issue: the code execution keeps getting hijacked by an unrelated 'Thieme-Becker image chronological analysis' task that produces irrelevant OCR output instead of analyzing the ScienceDirect Reference Works data. The workspace now contains the necessary PDF files and source data, but the actual statistical analysis for Reference Works distribution across Life Sciences and Health Sciences domains has not been performed. PLAN alignment: 50% complete - source collection and file downloads successful, but statistical data extraction completely failed due to persistent task confusion. Next step: Create focused code that directly analyzes the downloaded PDF content and extracted text files to find the specific statistical data about Reference Works distribution with sample standard deviations, avoiding any OCR or image analysis distractions. The target data should be extracted from the existing workspace files: sciencedirect_source_1_ELSEVIER_DATABASES_USER_TRAINING_AND_UPDATES.pdf and other downloaded sources.

📝 Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import re print("=== FOCUSED ANALYSIS: SCIENCEDIRECT REFERENCE WORKS STATISTICAL DATA ===\n") # Find workspace directory workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0] print(f"Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") "keyword">else: print("No workspace directory found.") exit() print(f"\nInspecting workspace files:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # First, let's properly inspect the promising sources file structure promising_sources_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;promising_sciencedirect_sources.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(promising_sources_file): print(f"\n=== INSPECTING PROMISING SOURCES FILE STRUCTURE ===\n") # Read first 200 characters to understand structure "keyword">with open(promising_sources_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: sample_content = f.read(200) print("First 200 characters:") print(sample_content) print("...\n") # Load "keyword">and examine structure safely "keyword">with open(promising_sources_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: data = json.load(f) print(f"Data type: {type(data)}") "keyword">if isinstance(data, list): print(f"List "keyword">with {len(data)} items") "keyword">if data: print(f"First item keys: {list(data[0].keys())}") print(f"First item structure:") "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in data[0].items(): print(f" {key}: {type(value)} - {str(value)[:50]}...") # Now focus on the most relevant sources "keyword">for Reference Works data print(f"\n=== ANALYZING TOP SOURCES FOR REFERENCE WORKS DATA ===\n") "keyword">if isinstance(data, list) "keyword">and data: # Sort by relevance score to get the best sources sorted_sources = sorted(data, key="keyword">lambda x: x.get(&#x27;relevance_score', 0), reverse="keyword">True) top_3_sources = sorted_sources[:3] print(f"Top 3 most relevant sources:") "keyword">for i, source "keyword">in enumerate(top_3_sources, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {source.get(&#x27;title', 'No title')}") print(f" URL: {source.get(&#x27;url', 'No URL')}") print(f" Relevance Score: {source.get(&#x27;relevance_score', 'N/A')}") print(f" Key Indicators: {list(source.get(&#x27;indicators', {}).keys())}") print(f" Snippet: {source.get(&#x27;snippet', 'No snippet')[:150]}...") # Check "keyword">if we already have downloaded content "keyword">if f.startswith(&#x27;sciencedirect_source_') "keyword">and f.endswith('.txt')] print(f"\n=== EXISTING DOWNLOADED CONTENT ===\n") print(f"PDF files: {len(pdf_files)}") "keyword">for pdf txt "keyword">in txt_files: txt_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, txt) txt_size = os.path.getsize(txt_path) print(f" - {txt} ({txt_size:,} bytes)") # If we don't have enough content, access the top sources "keyword">if len(pdf_files) + len(txt_files) < 3: print(f"\n=== ACCESSING ADDITIONAL SOURCES FOR REFERENCE WORKS DATA ===\n") headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; 'en-US,en;q=0.5' } "keyword">for i, source "keyword">in enumerate(top_3_sources, 1): url = source.get(&#x27;url', '') title = source.get(&#x27;title', f'Source {i}') # Skip "keyword">if we already have this content expected_filename = f"reference_works_analysis_{i}.txt" "keyword">if expected_filename "keyword">in existing_files: print(f"Skipping {title} - already downloaded") "keyword">continue text text = soup.get_text() lines = (line.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in text.splitlines()) clean_text = &#x27; '.join(line "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines "keyword">if line) # Save content txt_filename = f"reference_works_analysis_{i}.txt" txt_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, txt_filename) "keyword">with open(txt_path, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: content_lower.count('major reference works'), &#x27;life_sciences_mentions': content_lower.count('life sciences'), &#x27;health_sciences_mentions': content_lower.count('health sciences'), &#x27;statistics_mentions': content_lower.count('statistics') + content_lower.count('statistical'), &#x27;standard_deviation_mentions': content_lower.count('standard deviation') + content_lower.count('std dev'), &#x27;year_2022_mentions': content_lower.count('2022') } # Look "keyword">for numerical patterns numbers_pattern = re.findall(r&#x27;\b\d{1,4}\b', clean_text) statistical_terms = re.findall(r&#x27;(?:standard deviation|variance|sample size|mean|median)\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower) print(f"Key findings:") "keyword">for key, count "keyword">in key_findings.items(): "keyword">if count > 0: print(f" {key}: {count}") "keyword">if statistical_terms: print(f" Statistical values found: {statistical_terms[:5]}") "keyword">else: print(f"✗ Failed to access ({response.status_code})") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"✗ Error: {e}") print("-" * 50) # Now analyze all available content "keyword">for Reference Works statistical data print(f"\n=== COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF ALL DOWNLOADED CONTENT ===\n") all_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) analysis_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in all_files "keyword">if (f.startswith(&#x27;reference_works_') "keyword">or f.startswith('sciencedirect_source_')) "keyword">and (f.endswith('.txt') "keyword">or f.endswith('.pdf'))] print(f"Files to analyze: {len(analysis_files)}") "keyword">for file "keyword">in analysis_files: file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # Analyze text files "keyword">for statistical data statistical_findings = [] "keyword">for file "keyword">in analysis_files: "keyword">if file.endswith(&#x27;.txt'): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) print(f"\nAnalyzing: {file}") "keyword">with open(file_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: content = f.read() content_lower = content.lower() # Search "keyword">for specific Reference Works statistical data patterns = { &#x27;reference_works_counts': re.findall(r'(\d{1,5})\s+(?:reference works?|major reference works?)', content_lower), &#x27;life_sciences_numbers': re.findall(r'life sciences?[^.]*?(\d{1,4})', content_lower), &#x27;health_sciences_numbers': re.findall(r'health sciences?[^.]*?(\d{1,4})', content_lower), &#x27;standard_deviations': re.findall(r'(?:standard deviation|std\.?\s*dev\.?|σ)\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;sample_statistics': re.findall(r'(?:sample|n)\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+)', content_lower), &#x27;domain_statistics': re.findall(r'(?:domain|field|category)\s+[^.]*?(\d{1,4})', content_lower), &#x27;year_2022_data': re.findall(r'2022[^.]*?(\d{1,4})', content_lower) } # Count key term mentions term_counts = { &#x27;reference_works': content_lower.count('reference works'), &#x27;major_reference_works': content_lower.count('major reference works'), &#x27;sciencedirect': content_lower.count('sciencedirect'), &#x27;life_sciences': content_lower.count('life sciences'), &#x27;health_sciences': content_lower.count('health sciences'), &#x27;statistics': content_lower.count('statistics') + content_lower.count('statistical'), &#x27;distribution': content_lower.count('distribution'), &#x27;2022': content_lower.count('2022') } findings = { &#x27;filename': file, &#x27;content_length': len(content), &#x27;statistical_patterns': {k: v "keyword">for k, v "keyword">in patterns.items() "keyword">if v}, &#x27;term_mentions': {k: v "keyword">for k, v "keyword">in term_counts.items() "keyword">if v > 0} } "keyword">if findings[&#x27;statistical_patterns'] "keyword">or findings['term_mentions']: statistical_findings.append(findings) print(f" ✓ Found relevant data:") "keyword">if findings[&#x27;statistical_patterns']: print(f" Statistical patterns: {list(findings[&#x27;statistical_patterns'].keys())}") "keyword">for pattern, values "keyword">in findings[&#x27;statistical_patterns'].items(): print(f" {pattern}: {values[:3]}") "keyword">if findings[&#x27;term_mentions']: print(f" Key terms: {findings[&#x27;term_mentions']}") "keyword">else: print(f" - No relevant statistical data found") # Save comprehensive analysis final_analysis = { &#x27;objective': 'ScienceDirect Reference Works statistical data by academic domains', &#x27;target_domains': ['Life Sciences', 'Health Sciences'], &#x27;target_year': '2022', &#x27;target_statistics': 'sample standard deviations "keyword">for Reference Works distribution', &#x27;files_analyzed': len(analysis_files), &#x27;text_files_with_data': len(statistical_findings), &#x27;pdf_files_downloaded': len([f "keyword">for f "keyword">in analysis_files "keyword">if f.endswith('.pdf')]), &#x27;statistical_findings': statistical_findings } results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;sciencedirect_reference_works_final_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(results_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_analysis, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== FINAL ANALYSIS SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"Files analyzed: {final_analysis[&#x27;files_analyzed']}") print(f"Text files "keyword">with relevant data: {final_analysis[&#x27;text_files_with_data']}") print(f"PDF files downloaded: {final_analysis[&#x27;pdf_files_downloaded']}") print(f"Analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(results_file)}") "keyword">if statistical_findings: print(f"\n✓ SUCCESS: {finding[&#x27;filename']}:") "keyword">if finding.get(&#x27;statistical_patterns'): "keyword">for pattern, values "keyword">in finding[&#x27;statistical_patterns'].items(): print(f" {pattern}: 'life_sciences', 'health_sciences', 'statistics', '2022']} "keyword">if relevant_terms: print(f" Key term mentions: {relevant_terms}") "keyword">else: print(f"\n⚠️ Limited statistical data found "keyword">else: print(f"Invalid data structure "keyword">in promising sources file") "keyword">else: print(f"Promising sources file "keyword">not found: {promising_sources_file}") print(f"\n===
