developer Code Execution - Plan 02 (Iteration 2)
2025-08-11 06:31:25

Code execution result:

📝 Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from langchain_community.document_loaders "keyword">import PyPDFLoader "keyword">import re print("=== ADVANCED PDF ANALYSIS: SEARCHING FOR REFERENCE WORKS STATISTICAL DATA ===\n") # Find workspace directory workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0] print(f"Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") "keyword">else: print("No workspace directory found.") exit() print(f"\nCurrent workspace files:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # First, let's examine the extracted text files more carefully text_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir) "keyword">if f.endswith(&#x27;_extracted_text.txt')] print(f"\n=== DETAILED ANALYSIS OF EXTRACTED TEXT FILES ===\n") print(f"Found {len(text_files)} extracted text files") statistical_findings = [] "keyword">for text_file "keyword">in text_files: text_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, text_file) print(f"\nAnalyzing: {text_file}") print(f"File size: {os.path.getsize(text_path):,} bytes") "keyword">with open(text_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: content = f.read() print(f"Content length: {len(content):,} characters") # Show first 500 characters to understand content structure print(f"\nFirst 500 characters:") print(content[:500]) print("...\n") # Search "keyword">for more specific patterns related to Reference Works statistics content_lower = content.lower() # Look "keyword">for statistical tables "keyword">or structured data lines = content.split(&#x27;\n') statistical_lines = [] "keyword">for i, line "keyword">in enumerate(lines): line_lower = line.lower().strip() # Look "keyword">for lines containing statistical keywords "keyword">if any(keyword "keyword">in line_lower "keyword">for keyword "keyword">in [&#x27;statistics', 'statistical', 'data', 'analysis', 'metrics', 'distribution', 'standard deviation', 'variance', 'sample']): # Include context (previous "keyword">and next lines) context_start = max(0, i-2) context_end = min(len(lines), i+3) context = &#x27;\n'.join(lines[context_start:context_end]) statistical_lines.append({ &#x27;line_number': i+1, &#x27;line_content': line.strip(), &#x27;context': context }) print(f"Found {len(statistical_lines)} lines "keyword">with statistical keywords:") "keyword">for stat_line "keyword">in statistical_lines[:5]: # Show first 5 print(f" Line {stat_line[&#x27;line_number']}: {stat_line['line_content'][:100]}...") # Look "keyword">for numerical data "keyword">in context of Life Sciences "keyword">and Health Sciences domain_patterns = { &#x27;life_sciences_contexts': [], &#x27;health_sciences_contexts': [], &#x27;reference_works_contexts': [], &#x27;statistical_contexts': [] } # Split into sentences "keyword">for better context analysis sentences = re.split(r&#x27;[.!?\n]', content) "keyword">for sentence "keyword">in sentences: sentence_clean = sentence.strip() sentence_lower = sentence_clean.lower() "keyword">if len(sentence_clean) < 10: # Skip very short sentences "keyword">continue # Check "keyword">for domain-specific contexts "keyword">with numbers "keyword">if &#x27;life sciences' "keyword">in sentence_lower "keyword">and re.search(r'\d+', sentence_clean): domain_patterns[&#x27;life_sciences_contexts'].append(sentence_clean) "keyword">if &#x27;health sciences' "keyword">in sentence_lower "keyword">and re.search(r'\d+', sentence_clean): domain_patterns[&#x27;health_sciences_contexts'].append(sentence_clean) "keyword">if &#x27;reference works' "keyword">in sentence_lower "keyword">and re.search(r'\d+', sentence_clean): domain_patterns[&#x27;reference_works_contexts'].append(sentence_clean) "keyword">if any(stat_term "keyword">in sentence_lower "keyword">for stat_term "keyword">in [&#x27;standard deviation', 'variance', 'sample size', 'distribution', 'statistical']) "keyword">and re.search(r'\d+', sentence_clean): domain_patterns[&#x27;statistical_contexts'].append(sentence_clean) print(f"\n📊 Domain-specific contexts found:") "keyword">for pattern_name, contexts "keyword">in domain_patterns.items(): "keyword">if contexts: print(f" {pattern_name}: {len(contexts)} contexts") "keyword">for i, context "keyword">in enumerate(contexts[:2], 1): # Show first 2 print(f" {i}. {context[:150]}...") # Look "keyword">for tabular data "keyword">or structured numerical information # Search "keyword">for patterns that might indicate tables table_indicators = [] "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines: line_clean = line.strip() # Look "keyword">for lines "keyword">with multiple numbers "keyword">or structured data numbers_in_line = re.findall(r&#x27;\d+(?:\.\d+)?', line_clean) "keyword">if len(numbers_in_line) >= 2: # Lines "keyword">with 2+ numbers might be tabular table_indicators.append({ &#x27;line': line_clean, &#x27;numbers': numbers_in_line }) print(f"\n📋 Potential tabular data found: {len(table_indicators)} lines") "keyword">for i, table_line "keyword">in enumerate(table_indicators[:3], 1): # Show first 3 print(f" {i}. {table_line[&#x27;line'][:100]}... (Numbers: {table_line['numbers']})") # Advanced pattern matching "keyword">for statistical data advanced_patterns = { &#x27;domain_statistics': re.findall(r'(life sciences?|health sciences?)\s*[^.]*?(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;reference_works_numbers': re.findall(r'reference works?\s*[^.]*?(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;statistical_measures': re.findall(r'(mean|median|standard deviation|variance|sample size)\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;distribution_data': re.findall(r'distribution\s*[^.]*?(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;percentage_with_context': re.findall(r'([^.]*?)(\d{1,3}(?:\.\d{1,2})?)%([^.]*?)', content) } print(f"\n🔍 Advanced pattern analysis:") "keyword">for pattern_name, matches "keyword">in advanced_patterns.items(): "keyword">if matches: print(f" {pattern_name}: {len(matches)} matches") "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches[:3]: # Show first 3 print(f" {match}") # Save detailed analysis "keyword">for this file file_analysis = { &#x27;filename': text_file, &#x27;content_length': len(content), &#x27;statistical_lines_count': len(statistical_lines), &#x27;domain_contexts': {k: len(v) "keyword">for k, v "keyword">in domain_patterns.items()}, &#x27;tabular_data_lines': len(table_indicators), &#x27;advanced_patterns': {k: len(v) "keyword">for k, v "keyword">in advanced_patterns.items()}, &#x27;sample_contexts': { &#x27;life_sciences': domain_patterns['life_sciences_contexts'][:2], &#x27;health_sciences': domain_patterns['health_sciences_contexts'][:2], &#x27;reference_works': domain_patterns['reference_works_contexts'][:2], &#x27;statistical': domain_patterns['statistical_contexts'][:2] }, &#x27;sample_tabular_data': [t['line'] "keyword">for t "keyword">in table_indicators[:3]], &#x27;pattern_matches': {k: v[:3] "keyword">for k, v "keyword">in advanced_patterns.items() "keyword">if v} } statistical_findings.append(file_analysis) print("-" * 70) # Now let's "keyword">try a different approach - look "keyword">for the data "keyword">in the original search results print(f"\n=== EXAMINING SEARCH RESULTS FOR STATISTICAL DATA ===\n") search_results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;sciencedirect_reference_works_search_results.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(search_results_file): # First inspect the structure "keyword">with open(search_results_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: sample_content = f.read(200) print("Search results file structure (first 200 chars):") print(sample_content) print("...\n") # Load "keyword">and examine "keyword">with open(search_results_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: search_data = json.load(f) print(f"Search data type: {type(search_data)}") "keyword">if isinstance(search_data, list): print(f"Contains {len(search_data)} search queries") # Look through all search results "keyword">for statistical data all_snippets = [] "keyword">for query_data "keyword">in search_data: "keyword">if isinstance(query_data, dict) "keyword">and &#x27;results' "keyword">in query_data: "keyword">for result "keyword">in query_data[&#x27;results']: snippet = result.get(&#x27;snippet', '') title = result.get(&#x27;title', '') url = result.get(&#x27;link', '') # Look "keyword">for statistical indicators "keyword">in snippets snippet_lower = snippet.lower() "keyword">if any(term "keyword">in snippet_lower "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;standard deviation', 'sample', 'distribution', 'statistics', 'variance']): # Extract numbers "keyword">from the snippet numbers = re.findall(r&#x27;\d+(?:\.\d+)?', snippet) "keyword">if numbers: all_snippets.append({ &#x27;title': title, &#x27;url': url, &#x27;snippet': snippet, &#x27;numbers_found': numbers }) print(f"\nFound {len(all_snippets)} search results "keyword">with statistical indicators:") "keyword">for i, snippet_data "keyword">in enumerate(all_snippets[:3], 1): print(f"\n{i}. {snippet_data[&#x27;title'][:60]}...") print(f" Numbers: {snippet_data[&#x27;numbers_found']}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet_data[&#x27;snippet'][:150]}...") # Check "keyword">if we have any promising sources file "keyword">with more detailed data promising_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;promising_sciencedirect_sources.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(promising_file): print(f"\n=== EXAMINING PROMISING SOURCES FOR STATISTICAL DATA ===\n") # Inspect structure first "keyword">with open(promising_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: sample_content = f.read(200) print("Promising sources file structure (first 200 chars):") print(sample_content) print("...\n") "keyword">with open(promising_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: promising_data = json.load(f) print(f"Promising data type: {type(promising_data)}") "keyword">if isinstance(promising_data, list): print(f"Contains {len(promising_data)} promising sources") # Look "keyword">for sources "keyword">with statistical data "keyword">in snippets statistical_sources = [] "keyword">for source "keyword">in promising_data: "keyword">if isinstance(source, dict): snippet = source.get(&#x27;snippet', '').lower() "keyword">if any(term "keyword">in snippet "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;standard deviation', 'sample', 'distribution', 'statistics']): numbers = re.findall(r&#x27;\d+(?:\.\d+)?', source.get('snippet', '')) "keyword">if numbers: statistical_sources.append({ &#x27;title': source.get('title', 'No title'), &#x27;url': source.get('url', 'No URL'), &#x27;snippet': source.get('snippet', 'No snippet'), &#x27;numbers': numbers, &#x27;relevance_score': source.get('relevance_score', 0) }) print(f"\nFound {len(statistical_sources)} promising sources "keyword">with statistical data:") "keyword">for i, source "keyword">in enumerate(statistical_sources[:3], 1): print(f"\n{i}. {source[&#x27;title'][:60]}...") print(f" Relevance Score: {source[&#x27;relevance_score']}") print(f" Numbers: {source[&#x27;numbers']}") print(f" Snippet: {source[&#x27;snippet'][:150]}...") # Save comprehensive analysis final_analysis = { &#x27;objective': 'Extract sample standard deviations "keyword">for Reference Works distribution by academic domains', &#x27;target_domains': ['Life Sciences', 'Health Sciences'], &#x27;analysis_method': 'Advanced PDF text extraction "keyword">and pattern matching', &#x27;files_analyzed': len(text_files), &#x27;detailed_findings': statistical_findings, &#x27;search_results_examined': "keyword">True, &#x27;promising_sources_examined': "keyword">True, &#x27;status': 'Detailed analysis completed - statistical data may be "keyword">in visual/tabular format', &#x27;recommendations': [ &#x27;The target statistical data may be embedded "keyword">in tables, charts, "keyword">or images within the PDFs', &#x27;Consider using OCR "keyword">or specialized table extraction tools', &#x27;Manual inspection of the PDF files may be required to locate the specific data', &#x27;The numerical patterns found suggest the data exists but may "keyword">not be "keyword">in plain text format' ] } analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;advanced_statistical_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_analysis, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"Files analyzed: {len(text_files)}") print(f"Total statistical contexts found: {sum(f[&#x27;domain_contexts']['statistical'] "keyword">for f "keyword">in statistical_findings)}") print(f"Total Life Sciences contexts: {sum(f[&#x27;domain_contexts']['life_sciences'] "keyword">for f "keyword">in statistical_findings)}") print(f"Total Health Sciences contexts: {sum(f[&#x27;domain_contexts']['health_sciences'] "keyword">for f "keyword">in statistical_findings)}") print(f"Total Reference Works contexts: {sum(f[&#x27;domain_contexts']['reference_works'] "keyword">for f "keyword">in statistical_findings)}") print(f"Analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}") print(f"\n🎯 CONCLUSION:") print(f"The PDF files contain Reference Works data "keyword">and domain-specific information,") print(f"but the specific sample standard deviations "keyword">for Life Sciences "keyword">and Health Sciences") print(f"domains may be embedded "keyword">in tables, charts, "keyword">or visual elements that require") print(f"specialized extraction techniques beyond plain text parsing.") print(f"\n📁 FINAL WORKSPACE STATUS:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")

2025-08-11 06:31:25

Execution failed - The code ran and successfully extracted text from 2 PDF files (472KB and 13MB) containing Reference Works data, but encountered a critical KeyError: 'statistical' on line 277 during the final analysis phase. The code processed the PDFs and found some relevant patterns including Reference Works mentions (6 in source 1, 2 in source 2), Life Sciences data (44), Health Sciences data (44), and various percentage values. However, the execution crashed when trying to access a 'statistical' key that doesn't exist in the statistical_findings data structure. PLAN alignment: 75% complete - PDF text extraction and pattern matching were successful, but the final analysis failed due to a data structure error. Next step: Fix the KeyError by properly handling the statistical_findings dictionary structure, then continue analyzing the extracted text files to locate the specific sample standard deviations for Reference Works distribution across Life Sciences and Health Sciences domains. The workspace contains the necessary extracted text files (3,599 and 35,851 bytes) that need proper statistical analysis to find the target standard deviation values.

📝 Code Python

sciences?)\s*[^.]*?(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;reference_works_numbers': re.findall(r'reference works?\s*[^.]*?(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;statistical_measures': re.findall(r'(mean|median|standard deviation|variance|sample size)\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;distribution_data': re.findall(r'distribution\s*[^.]*?(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;percentage_with_context': re.findall(r'([^.]*?)(\d{1,3}(?:\.\d{1,2})?)%([^.]*?)', content) } print(f"\n🔍 Advanced pattern analysis:") "keyword">for pattern_name, matches "keyword">in advanced_patterns.items(): "keyword">if matches: print(f" {pattern_name}: {len(matches)} matches") "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches[:3]: # Show first 3 print(f" {match}") # Save detailed analysis "keyword">for this file file_analysis = { &#x27;filename': text_file, &#x27;content_length': len(content), &#x27;statistical_lines_count': len(statistical_lines), &#x27;domain_contexts': {k: len(v) "keyword">for k, v "keyword">in domain_patterns.items()}, &#x27;tabular_data_lines': len(table_indicators), &#x27;advanced_patterns': {k: len(v) "keyword">for k, v "keyword">in advanced_patterns.items()}, &#x27;sample_contexts': { &#x27;life_sciences': domain_patterns['life_sciences_contexts'][:2], &#x27;health_sciences': domain_patterns['health_sciences_contexts'][:2], &#x27;reference_works': domain_patterns['reference_works_contexts'][:2], &#x27;statistical': domain_patterns['statistical_contexts'][:2] }, &#x27;sample_tabular_data': [t['line'] "keyword">for t "keyword">in table_indicators[:3]], &#x27;pattern_matches': {k: v[:3] "keyword">for k, v "keyword">in advanced_patterns.items() "keyword">if v} } statistical_findings.append(file_analysis) print("-" * 70) # Now let's "keyword">try a different approach - look "keyword">for the data "keyword">in the original search results print(f"\n=== EXAMINING SEARCH RESULTS FOR STATISTICAL DATA ===\n") search_results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;sciencedirect_reference_works_search_results.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(search_results_file): # First inspect the structure "keyword">with open(search_results_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: sample_content = f.read(200) print("Search results file structure (first 200 chars):") print(sample_content) print("...\n") # Load "keyword">and examine "keyword">with open(search_results_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: search_data = json.load(f) print(f"Search data type: {type(search_data)}") "keyword">if isinstance(search_data, list): print(f"Contains {len(search_data)} search queries") # Look through all search results "keyword">for statistical data all_snippets = [] "keyword">for query_data "keyword">in search_data: "keyword">if isinstance(query_data, dict) "keyword">and &#x27;results' "keyword">in query_data: "keyword">for result "keyword">in query_data[&#x27;results']: snippet = result.get(&#x27;snippet', '') title = result.get(&#x27;title', '') url = result.get(&#x27;link', '') # Look "keyword">for statistical indicators "keyword">in snippets snippet_lower = snippet.lower() "keyword">if any(term "keyword">in snippet_lower "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;standard deviation', 'sample', 'distribution', 'statistics', 'variance']): # Extract numbers "keyword">from the snippet numbers = re.findall(r&#x27;\d+(?:\.\d+)?', snippet) "keyword">if numbers: all_snippets.append({ &#x27;title': title, &#x27;url': url, &#x27;snippet': snippet, &#x27;numbers_found': numbers }) print(f"\nFound {len(all_snippets)} search results "keyword">with statistical indicators:") "keyword">for i, snippet_data "keyword">in enumerate(all_snippets[:3], 1): print(f"\n{i}. {snippet_data[&#x27;title'][:60]}...") print(f" Numbers: {snippet_data[&#x27;numbers_found']}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet_data[&#x27;snippet'][:150]}...") # Check "keyword">if we have any promising sources file "keyword">with more detailed data promising_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;promising_sciencedirect_sources.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(promising_file): print(f"\n=== EXAMINING PROMISING SOURCES FOR STATISTICAL DATA ===\n") # Inspect structure first "keyword">with open(promising_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: sample_content = f.read(200) print("Promising sources file structure (first 200 chars):") print(sample_content) print("...\n") "keyword">with open(promising_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: promising_data = json.load(f) print(f"Promising data type: {type(promising_data)}") "keyword">if isinstance(promising_data, list): print(f"Contains {len(promising_data)} promising sources") # Look "keyword">for sources "keyword">with statistical data "keyword">in snippets statistical_sources = [] "keyword">for source "keyword">in promising_data: "keyword">if isinstance(source, dict): snippet = source.get(&#x27;snippet', '').lower() "keyword">if any(term "keyword">in snippet "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;standard deviation', 'sample', 'distribution', 'statistics']): numbers = re.findall(r&#x27;\d+(?:\.\d+)?', source.get('snippet', '')) "keyword">if numbers: statistical_sources.append({ &#x27;title': source.get('title', 'No title'), &#x27;url': source.get('url', 'No URL'), &#x27;snippet': source.get('snippet', 'No snippet'), &#x27;numbers': numbers, &#x27;relevance_score': source.get('relevance_score', 0) }) print(f"\nFound {len(statistical_sources)} promising sources "keyword">with statistical data:") "keyword">for i, source "keyword">in enumerate(statistical_sources[:3], 1): print(f"\n{i}. {source[&#x27;title'][:60]}...") print(f" Relevance Score: {source[&#x27;relevance_score']}") print(f" Numbers: {source[&#x27;numbers']}") print(f" Snippet: {source[&#x27;snippet'][:150]}...") # Save comprehensive analysis final_analysis = { &#x27;objective': 'Extract sample standard deviations "keyword">for Reference Works distribution by academic domains', &#x27;target_domains': ['Life Sciences', 'Health Sciences'], &#x27;analysis_method': 'Advanced PDF text extraction "keyword">and pattern matching', &#x27;files_analyzed': len(text_files), &#x27;detailed_findings': statistical_findings, &#x27;search_results_examined': "keyword">True, &#x27;promising_sources_examined': "keyword">True, &#x27;status': 'Detailed analysis completed - statistical data may be "keyword">in visual/tabular format', &#x27;recommendations': [ &#x27;The target statistical data may be embedded "keyword">in tables, charts, "keyword">or images within the PDFs', &#x27;Consider using OCR "keyword">or specialized table extraction tools', &#x27;Manual inspection of the PDF files may be required to locate the specific data', &#x27;The numerical patterns found suggest the data exists but may "keyword">not be "keyword">in plain text format' ] } analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;advanced_statistical_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_analysis, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"Files analyzed: {len(text_files)}") print(f"Total statistical contexts found: {sum(f[&#x27;domain_contexts']['statistical'] "keyword">for f "keyword">in statistical_findings)}") print(f"Total Life Sciences contexts: {sum(f[&#x27;domain_contexts']['life_sciences'] "keyword">for f "keyword">in statistical_findings)}") print(f"Total Health Sciences contexts: {sum(f[&#x27;domain_contexts']['health_sciences'] "keyword">for f "keyword">in statistical_findings)}") print(f"Total Reference Works contexts: {sum(f[&#x27;domain_contexts']['reference_works'] "keyword">for f "keyword">in statistical_findings)}") print(f"Analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}") print(f"\n🎯 CONCLUSION:") print(f"The PDF files contain Reference Works data "keyword">and domain-specific information,") print(f"but the specific sample standard deviations "keyword">for Life Sciences "keyword">and Health Sciences") print(f"domains may be embedded "keyword">in tables, charts, "keyword">or visual elements that require") print(f"specialized extraction techniques beyond plain text parsing.") print(f"\n📁 FINAL WORKSPACE STATUS:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")
📄 Output

📝 Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from langchain_community.document_loaders "keyword">import PyPDFLoader "keyword">import re print("=== FIXED ANALYSIS: EXTRACTING REFERENCE WORKS STATISTICAL DATA ===\n") # Find workspace directory workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0] print(f"Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") "keyword">else: print("No workspace directory found.") exit() print(f"\nCurrent workspace files:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # First, let's carefully examine the extracted text files "keyword">for statistical data text_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir) "keyword">if f.endswith(&#x27;_extracted_text.txt')] print(f"\n=== CAREFUL ANALYSIS OF EXTRACTED TEXT FILES ===\n") print(f"Found {len(text_files)} extracted text files") statistical_findings = [] "keyword">for text_file "keyword">in text_files: text_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, text_file) print(f"\nAnalyzing: {text_file}") print(f"File size: {os.path.getsize(text_path):,} bytes") "keyword">with open(text_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: content = f.read() print(f"Content length: {len(content):,} characters") # Show a meaningful preview of the content print(f"\nContent preview (first 800 characters):") print(content[:800]) print("...\n") # Search "keyword">for statistical data patterns more carefully content_lower = content.lower() # Look "keyword">for domain-specific contexts "keyword">with numbers domain_contexts = { &#x27;life_sciences_contexts': [], &#x27;health_sciences_contexts': [], &#x27;reference_works_contexts': [], &#x27;statistical_contexts': [] } # Split into sentences "keyword">for better context analysis sentences = re.split(r&#x27;[.!?\n]', content) "keyword">for sentence "keyword">in sentences: sentence_clean = sentence.strip() sentence_lower = sentence_clean.lower() "keyword">if len(sentence_clean) < 10: # Skip very short sentences "keyword">continue # Check "keyword">for domain-specific contexts "keyword">with numbers "keyword">if &#x27;life sciences' "keyword">in sentence_lower "keyword">and re.search(r'\d+', sentence_clean): domain_contexts[&#x27;life_sciences_contexts'].append(sentence_clean) "keyword">if &#x27;health sciences' "keyword">in sentence_lower "keyword">and re.search(r'\d+', sentence_clean): domain_contexts[&#x27;health_sciences_contexts'].append(sentence_clean) "keyword">if &#x27;reference works' "keyword">in sentence_lower "keyword">and re.search(r'\d+', sentence_clean): domain_contexts[&#x27;reference_works_contexts'].append(sentence_clean) "keyword">if any(stat_term "keyword">in sentence_lower "keyword">for stat_term "keyword">in [&#x27;standard deviation', 'variance', 'sample size', 'distribution', 'statistical']) "keyword">and re.search(r'\d+', sentence_clean): domain_contexts[&#x27;statistical_contexts'].append(sentence_clean) print(f"📊 Domain-specific contexts found:") "keyword">for pattern_name, contexts "keyword">in domain_contexts.items(): "keyword">if contexts: print(f" {pattern_name}: {len(contexts)} contexts") "keyword">for i, context "keyword">in enumerate(contexts[:3], 1): # Show first 3 print(f" {i}. {context[:200]}...") # Look "keyword">for numerical patterns that might be standard deviations # Standard deviations are typically decimal numbers decimal_numbers = re.findall(r&#x27;\d+\.\d+', content) print(f"\n🔢 Decimal numbers found: {decimal_numbers[:10]}") # Look "keyword">for specific statistical terminology statistical_terms = { &#x27;standard_deviation': content_lower.count('standard deviation'), &#x27;std_dev': content_lower.count('std dev'), &#x27;variance': content_lower.count('variance'), &#x27;sample_size': content_lower.count('sample size'), &#x27;distribution': content_lower.count('distribution'), &#x27;mean': content_lower.count('mean'), &#x27;median': content_lower.count('median') } print(f"\n📈 Statistical terms frequency:") "keyword">for term, count "keyword">in statistical_terms.items(): "keyword">if count > 0: print(f" {term}: {count} mentions") # Look "keyword">for patterns that might indicate sample standard deviations # Search "keyword">for contexts containing both domain names "keyword">and numerical values potential_std_devs = [] # Check each sentence "keyword">for potential statistical data "keyword">for sentence "keyword">in sentences: sentence_clean = sentence.strip() sentence_lower = sentence_clean.lower() # Look "keyword">for sentences mentioning domains "keyword">with numbers "keyword">if (&#x27;life sciences' "keyword">in sentence_lower "keyword">or 'health sciences' "keyword">in sentence_lower) "keyword">and re.search(r'\d+(?:\.\d+)?', sentence_clean): numbers = re.findall(r&#x27;\d+(?:\.\d+)?', sentence_clean) potential_std_devs.append({ &#x27;sentence': sentence_clean, &#x27;numbers': numbers, &#x27;domain': 'life_sciences' "keyword">if 'life sciences' "keyword">in sentence_lower "keyword">else 'health_sciences' }) print(f"\n🎯 Potential domain-specific statistical data:") "keyword">for i, data "keyword">in enumerate(potential_std_devs[:5], 1): print(f" {i}. Domain: {data[&#x27;domain']}") print(f" Numbers: {data[&#x27;numbers']}") print(f" Context: {data[&#x27;sentence'][:150]}...") # Save findings "keyword">for this file file_analysis = { &#x27;filename': text_file, &#x27;content_length': len(content), &#x27;domain_contexts_count': {k: len(v) "keyword">for k, v "keyword">in domain_contexts.items()}, &#x27;statistical_terms': statistical_terms, &#x27;decimal_numbers': decimal_numbers[:20], # Limit to first 20 &#x27;potential_std_devs': potential_std_devs[:10], # Limit to first 10 &#x27;sample_contexts': { &#x27;life_sciences': domain_contexts['life_sciences_contexts'][:2], &#x27;health_sciences': domain_contexts['health_sciences_contexts'][:2], &#x27;reference_works': domain_contexts['reference_works_contexts'][:2] } } statistical_findings.append(file_analysis) print("-" * 70) # Now let's examine the search results more carefully "keyword">for statistical data print(f"\n=== EXAMINING SEARCH RESULTS FOR SAMPLE STANDARD DEVIATIONS ===\n") search_results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;sciencedirect_reference_works_search_results.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(search_results_file): # First inspect the structure safely print("Inspecting search results file structure...") "keyword">with open(search_results_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: "keyword">try: search_data = json.load(f) print(f"Search data type: {type(search_data)}") "keyword">if isinstance(search_data, list) "keyword">and search_data: print(f"Contains {len(search_data)} search queries") print(f"First query keys: {list(search_data[0].keys())}") # Look "keyword">for the specific search result that mentioned statistical data statistical_results = [] "keyword">for query_data "keyword">in search_data: "keyword">if isinstance(query_data, dict) "keyword">and &#x27;results' "keyword">in query_data: query_text = query_data.get(&#x27;query', '') print(f"\nExamining query: {query_text[:80]}...") "keyword">for result "keyword">in query_data[&#x27;results']: title = result.get(&#x27;title', '') snippet = result.get(&#x27;snippet', '') url = result.get(&#x27;link', '') # Look "keyword">for the specific result about citation differences "keyword">if &#x27;citation differences' "keyword">in title.lower() "keyword">or 'sample included' "keyword">in snippet.lower(): print(f"\n🎯 FOUND STATISTICAL RESULT:") print(f"Title: {title}") print(f"URL: {url}") print(f"Snippet: {snippet}") # Extract the specific numbers mentioned numbers = re.findall(r&#x27;\d+', snippet) print(f"Numbers found: {numbers}") # This snippet mentions: "12 subject categories "keyword">from Health Sciences, 7 "keyword">from Life Sciences" # Let's parse this more carefully "keyword">if &#x27;12 subject categories "keyword">from health sciences' "keyword">in snippet.lower() "keyword">and '7 "keyword">from life sciences' "keyword">in snippet.lower(): print(f"\n✅ POTENTIAL SAMPLE DATA FOUND:") print(f"Health Sciences sample: 12 categories") print(f"Life Sciences sample: 7 categories") # These might be sample sizes, "keyword">not standard deviations # But they indicate the structure of the data we're looking "keyword">for statistical_results.append({ &#x27;title': title, &#x27;url': url, &#x27;snippet': snippet, &#x27;health_sciences_value': 12, &#x27;life_sciences_value': 7, &#x27;data_type': 'sample_categories' }) "keyword">if statistical_results: print(f"\n📊 STATISTICAL RESULTS SUMMARY:") "keyword">for result "keyword">in statistical_results: print(f"\nTitle: {result[&#x27;title']}") print(f"Health Sciences value: {result[&#x27;health_sciences_value']}") print(f"Life Sciences value: {result[&#x27;life_sciences_value']}") print(f"Data type: {result[&#x27;data_type']}") # If these were standard deviations, calculate the difference "keyword">if result[&#x27;data_type'] == 'sample_categories': difference = abs(result[&#x27;health_sciences_value'] - result['life_sciences_value']) print(f"Difference: {difference}") print(f"Note: These appear to be sample categories, "keyword">not standard deviations") "keyword">except json.JSONDecodeError "keyword">as e: print(f"Error reading search results file: {e}") # Let's also manually search "keyword">for any decimal numbers that could be standard deviations print(f"\n=== MANUAL SEARCH FOR STANDARD DEVIATION VALUES ===\n") # Look through all text content "keyword">for potential standard deviation values all_decimal_numbers = [] "keyword">for finding "keyword">in statistical_findings: all_decimal_numbers.extend(finding[&#x27;decimal_numbers']) print(f"All decimal numbers found across files: {set(all_decimal_numbers)}") # Filter "keyword">for reasonable standard deviation values (typically between 0.1 "keyword">and 50) reasonable_std_devs = [] "keyword">for num_str "keyword">in set(all_decimal_numbers): "keyword">try: num = float(num_str) "keyword">if 0.1 <= num <= 50.0: # Reasonable range "keyword">for standard deviations reasonable_std_devs.append(num) "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">continue print(f"Reasonable standard deviation candidates: {sorted(reasonable_std_devs)}") # Save comprehensive analysis "keyword">with fixed structure final_analysis = { &#x27;objective': 'Extract sample standard deviations "keyword">for Reference Works distribution by academic domains', &#x27;target_domains': ['Life Sciences', 'Health Sciences'], &#x27;analysis_method': 'Fixed PDF text extraction "keyword">and careful pattern matching', &#x27;files_analyzed': len(text_files), &#x27;detailed_findings': statistical_findings, &#x27;decimal_numbers_found': list(set(all_decimal_numbers)), &#x27;reasonable_std_dev_candidates': sorted(reasonable_std_devs), &#x27;search_results_examined': "keyword">True, &#x27;status': 'Analysis completed - potential statistical data identified', &#x27;key_findings': { &#x27;citation_study_data': { &#x27;health_sciences_categories': 12, &#x27;life_sciences_categories': 7, &#x27;difference': 5, &#x27;note': 'These are sample category counts, "keyword">not standard deviations' } }, &#x27;recommendations': [ &#x27;The PDFs contain Reference Works data but may "keyword">not have the specific sample standard deviations', &#x27;The citation study data shows 12 Health Sciences vs 7 Life Sciences categories', &#x27;Standard deviation values may be embedded "keyword">in tables "keyword">or charts "keyword">not captured by text extraction', &#x27;Consider accessing the original research paper mentioned "keyword">in the citation study' ] } analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;fixed_statistical_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_analysis, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== FINAL ANALYSIS SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"Files analyzed: {len(text_files)}") print(f"Decimal numbers found: {len(set(all_decimal_numbers))}") print(f"Reasonable std dev candidates: {len(reasonable_std_devs)}") print(f"Analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}") # Check "keyword">if we found any potential standard deviation values "keyword">if reasonable_std_devs: print(f"\n🎯 POTENTIAL STANDARD DEVIATION VALUES FOUND:") "keyword">for value "keyword">in sorted(reasonable_std_devs): print(f" - {value}") # If we have exactly 2 values, they might be our target standard deviations "keyword">if len(reasonable_std_devs) == 2: std_dev_1, std_dev_2 = sorted(reasonable_std_devs) difference = abs(std_dev_1 - std_dev_2) print(f"\n✅ POTENTIAL ANSWER:") print(f"Standard deviation 1: {std_dev_1}") print(f"Standard deviation 2: {std_dev_2}") print(f"Difference (to 3 decimal places): {difference:.3f}") print(f"\nNote: These values need verification against the original context") "keyword">else: print(f"\n⚠️ No clear standard deviation values found "keyword">in the extracted text") print(f"The target data may be "keyword">in visual/tabular format within the PDFs") print(f"\n📁 FINAL WORKSPACE STATUS:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")
📄 Output

2025-08-11 06:32:41

Execution successful - Code ran without errors and completed a comprehensive analysis of the downloaded PDF files to extract Reference Works statistical data. The code successfully processed 2 extracted text files using LangChain PyPDFLoader, analyzing the 'Elsevier Major Reference Works 2022' PDF (472,562 bytes) and 'ELSEVIER DATABASES USER TRAINING' PDF (13,373,292 bytes). The analysis found relevant numerical patterns including decimal numbers (0.93, 1.0, 1.2, 4.0, 4.1, 5.0, 7.5, 8.0, 20.0, 23.0, 25.3, 25.52) that could be potential standard deviation candidates, and identified a key statistical source mentioning '12 subject categories from Health Sciences, 7 from Life Sciences'. However, the code did not find the specific sample standard deviations for Reference Works distribution across Life Sciences and Health Sciences domains from 2022. PLAN alignment: 90% complete - successfully extracted and analyzed PDF content with comprehensive pattern matching, but the target statistical values may be embedded in visual/tabular format within the PDFs rather than plain text. The workspace contains detailed analysis files including fixed_statistical_analysis.json (3,311 bytes) with comprehensive findings. Recommendation: The analysis has successfully identified and processed the authoritative ScienceDirect Reference Works sources, but the specific sample standard deviations needed to calculate the difference to 3 decimal places may require manual inspection of the PDF files or specialized table extraction techniques to access data in charts or structured formats.

📝 Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from langchain_community.document_loaders "keyword">import PyPDFLoader "keyword">import re print("=== FIXED ANALYSIS: EXTRACTING REFERENCE WORKS STATISTICAL DATA ===\n") # Find workspace directory workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0] print(f"Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") "keyword">else: print("No workspace directory found.") exit() print(f"\nCurrent workspace files:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # First, let's carefully examine the extracted text files "keyword">for statistical data text_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir) "keyword">if f.endswith(&#x27;_extracted_text.txt')] print(f"\n=== CAREFUL ANALYSIS OF EXTRACTED TEXT FILES ===\n") print(f"Found {len(text_files)} extracted text files") statistical_findings = [] "keyword">for text_file "keyword">in text_files: text_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, text_file) print(f"\nAnalyzing: {text_file}") print(f"File size: {os.path.getsize(text_path):,} bytes") "keyword">with open(text_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: content = f.read() print(f"Content length: {len(content):,} characters") # Show a meaningful preview of the content print(f"\nContent preview (first 800 characters):") print(content[:800]) print("...\n") # Search "keyword">for statistical data patterns more carefully content_lower = content.lower() # Look "keyword">for domain-specific contexts "keyword">with numbers domain_contexts = { &#x27;life_sciences_contexts': [], &#x27;health_sciences_contexts': [], &#x27;reference_works_contexts': [], &#x27;statistical_contexts': [] } # Split into sentences "keyword">for better context analysis sentences = re.split(r&#x27;[.!?\n]', content) "keyword">for sentence "keyword">in sentences: sentence_clean = sentence.strip() sentence_lower = sentence_clean.lower() "keyword">if len(sentence_clean) < 10: # Skip very short sentences "keyword">continue # Check "keyword">for domain-specific contexts "keyword">with numbers "keyword">if &#x27;life sciences' "keyword">in sentence_lower "keyword">and re.search(r'\d+', sentence_clean): domain_contexts[&#x27;life_sciences_contexts'].append(sentence_clean) "keyword">if &#x27;health sciences' "keyword">in sentence_lower "keyword">and re.search(r'\d+', sentence_clean): domain_contexts[&#x27;health_sciences_contexts'].append(sentence_clean) "keyword">if &#x27;reference works' "keyword">in sentence_lower "keyword">and re.search(r'\d+', sentence_clean): domain_contexts[&#x27;reference_works_contexts'].append(sentence_clean) "keyword">if any(stat_term "keyword">in sentence_lower "keyword">for stat_term "keyword">in [&#x27;standard deviation', 'variance', 'sample size', 'distribution', 'statistical']) "keyword">and re.search(r'\d+', sentence_clean): domain_contexts[&#x27;statistical_contexts'].append(sentence_clean) print(f"📊 Domain-specific contexts found:") "keyword">for pattern_name, contexts "keyword">in domain_contexts.items(): "keyword">if contexts: print(f" {pattern_name}: {len(contexts)} contexts") "keyword">for i, context "keyword">in enumerate(contexts[:3], 1): # Show first 3 print(f" {i}. {context[:200]}...") # Look "keyword">for numerical patterns that might be standard deviations # Standard deviations are typically decimal numbers decimal_numbers = re.findall(r&#x27;\d+\.\d+', content) print(f"\n🔢 Decimal numbers found: {decimal_numbers[:10]}") # Look "keyword">for specific statistical terminology statistical_terms = { &#x27;standard_deviation': content_lower.count('standard deviation'), &#x27;std_dev': content_lower.count('std dev'), &#x27;variance': content_lower.count('variance'), &#x27;sample_size': content_lower.count('sample size'), &#x27;distribution': content_lower.count('distribution'), &#x27;mean': content_lower.count('mean'), &#x27;median': content_lower.count('median') } print(f"\n📈 Statistical terms frequency:") "keyword">for term, count "keyword">in statistical_terms.items(): "keyword">if count > 0: print(f" {term}: {count} mentions") # Look "keyword">for patterns that might indicate sample standard deviations # Search "keyword">for contexts containing both domain names "keyword">and numerical values potential_std_devs = [] # Check each sentence "keyword">for potential statistical data "keyword">for sentence "keyword">in sentences: sentence_clean = sentence.strip() sentence_lower = sentence_clean.lower() # Look "keyword">for sentences mentioning domains "keyword">with numbers "keyword">if (&#x27;life sciences' "keyword">in sentence_lower "keyword">or 'health sciences' "keyword">in sentence_lower) "keyword">and re.search(r'\d+(?:\.\d+)?', sentence_clean): numbers = re.findall(r&#x27;\d+(?:\.\d+)?', sentence_clean) potential_std_devs.append({ &#x27;sentence': sentence_clean, &#x27;numbers': numbers, &#x27;domain': 'life_sciences' "keyword">if 'life sciences' "keyword">in sentence_lower "keyword">else 'health_sciences' }) print(f"\n🎯 Potential domain-specific statistical data:") "keyword">for i, data "keyword">in enumerate(potential_std_devs[:5], 1): print(f" {i}. Domain: {data[&#x27;domain']}") print(f" Numbers: {data[&#x27;numbers']}") print(f" Context: {data[&#x27;sentence'][:150]}...") # Save findings "keyword">for this file file_analysis = { &#x27;filename': text_file, &#x27;content_length': len(content), &#x27;domain_contexts_count': {k: len(v) "keyword">for k, v "keyword">in domain_contexts.items()}, &#x27;statistical_terms': statistical_terms, &#x27;decimal_numbers': decimal_numbers[:20], # Limit to first 20 &#x27;potential_std_devs': potential_std_devs[:10], # Limit to first 10 &#x27;sample_contexts': { &#x27;life_sciences': domain_contexts['life_sciences_contexts'][:2], &#x27;health_sciences': domain_contexts['health_sciences_contexts'][:2], &#x27;reference_works': domain_contexts['reference_works_contexts'][:2] } } statistical_findings.append(file_analysis) print("-" * 70) # Now let's examine the search results more carefully "keyword">for statistical data print(f"\n=== EXAMINING SEARCH RESULTS FOR SAMPLE STANDARD DEVIATIONS ===\n") search_results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;sciencedirect_reference_works_search_results.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(search_results_file): # First inspect the structure safely print("Inspecting search results file structure...") "keyword">with open(search_results_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: "keyword">try: search_data = json.load(f) print(f"Search data type: {type(search_data)}") "keyword">if isinstance(search_data, list) "keyword">and search_data: print(f"Contains {len(search_data)} search queries") print(f"First query keys: {list(search_data[0].keys())}") # Look "keyword">for the specific search result that mentioned statistical data statistical_results = [] "keyword">for query_data "keyword">in search_data: "keyword">if isinstance(query_data, dict) "keyword">and &#x27;results' "keyword">in query_data: query_text = query_data.get(&#x27;query', '') print(f"\nExamining query: {query_text[:80]}...") "keyword">for result "keyword">in query_data[&#x27;results']: title = result.get(&#x27;title', '') snippet = result.get(&#x27;snippet', '') url = result.get(&#x27;link', '') # Look "keyword">for the specific result about citation differences "keyword">if &#x27;citation differences' "keyword">in title.lower() "keyword">or 'sample included' "keyword">in snippet.lower(): print(f"\n🎯 FOUND STATISTICAL RESULT:") print(f"Title: {title}") print(f"URL: {url}") print(f"Snippet: {snippet}") # Extract the specific numbers mentioned numbers = re.findall(r&#x27;\d+', snippet) print(f"Numbers found: {numbers}") # This snippet mentions: "12 subject categories "keyword">from Health Sciences, 7 "keyword">from Life Sciences" # Let's parse this more carefully "keyword">if &#x27;12 subject categories "keyword">from health sciences' "keyword">in snippet.lower() "keyword">and '7 "keyword">from life sciences' "keyword">in snippet.lower(): print(f"\n✅ POTENTIAL SAMPLE DATA FOUND:") print(f"Health Sciences sample: 12 categories") print(f"Life Sciences sample: 7 categories") # These might be sample sizes, "keyword">not standard deviations # But they indicate the structure of the data we're looking "keyword">for statistical_results.append({ &#x27;title': title, &#x27;url': url, &#x27;snippet': snippet, &#x27;health_sciences_value': 12, &#x27;life_sciences_value': 7, &#x27;data_type': 'sample_categories' }) "keyword">if statistical_results: print(f"\n📊 STATISTICAL RESULTS SUMMARY:") "keyword">for result "keyword">in statistical_results: print(f"\nTitle: {result[&#x27;title']}") print(f"Health Sciences value: {result[&#x27;health_sciences_value']}") print(f"Life Sciences value: {result[&#x27;life_sciences_value']}") print(f"Data type: {result[&#x27;data_type']}") # If these were standard deviations, calculate the difference "keyword">if result[&#x27;data_type'] == 'sample_categories': difference = abs(result[&#x27;health_sciences_value'] - result['life_sciences_value']) print(f"Difference: {difference}") print(f"Note: These appear to be sample categories, "keyword">not standard deviations") "keyword">except json.JSONDecodeError "keyword">as e: print(f"Error reading search results file: {e}") # Let's also manually search "keyword">for any decimal numbers that could be standard deviations print(f"\n=== MANUAL SEARCH FOR STANDARD DEVIATION VALUES ===\n") # Look through all text content "keyword">for potential standard deviation values all_decimal_numbers = [] "keyword">for finding "keyword">in statistical_findings: all_decimal_numbers.extend(finding[&#x27;decimal_numbers']) print(f"All decimal numbers found across files: {set(all_decimal_numbers)}") # Filter "keyword">for reasonable standard deviation values (typically between 0.1 "keyword">and 50) reasonable_std_devs = [] "keyword">for num_str "keyword">in set(all_decimal_numbers): "keyword">try: num = float(num_str) "keyword">if 0.1 <= num <= 50.0: # Reasonable range "keyword">for standard deviations reasonable_std_devs.append(num) "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">continue print(f"Reasonable standard deviation candidates: {sorted(reasonable_std_devs)}") # Save comprehensive analysis "keyword">with fixed structure final_analysis = { &#x27;objective': 'Extract sample standard deviations "keyword">for Reference Works distribution by academic domains', &#x27;target_domains': ['Life Sciences', 'Health Sciences'], &#x27;analysis_method': 'Fixed PDF text extraction "keyword">and careful pattern matching', &#x27;files_analyzed': len(text_files), &#x27;detailed_findings': statistical_findings, &#x27;decimal_numbers_found': list(set(all_decimal_numbers)), &#x27;reasonable_std_dev_candidates': sorted(reasonable_std_devs), &#x27;search_results_examined': "keyword">True, &#x27;status': 'Analysis completed - potential statistical data identified', &#x27;key_findings': { &#x27;citation_study_data': { &#x27;health_sciences_categories': 12, &#x27;life_sciences_categories': 7, &#x27;difference': 5, &#x27;note': 'These are sample category counts, "keyword">not standard deviations' } }, &#x27;recommendations': [ &#x27;The PDFs contain Reference Works data but may "keyword">not have the specific sample standard deviations', &#x27;The citation study data shows 12 Health Sciences vs 7 Life Sciences categories', &#x27;Standard deviation values may be embedded "keyword">in tables "keyword">or charts "keyword">not captured by text extraction', &#x27;Consider accessing the original research paper mentioned "keyword">in the citation study' ] } analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;fixed_statistical_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_analysis, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== FINAL ANALYSIS SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"Files analyzed: {len(text_files)}") print(f"Decimal numbers found: {len(set(all_decimal_numbers))}") print(f"Reasonable std dev candidates: {len(reasonable_std_devs)}") print(f"Analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}") # Check "keyword">if we found any potential standard deviation values "keyword">if reasonable_std_devs: print(f"\n🎯 POTENTIAL STANDARD DEVIATION VALUES FOUND:") "keyword">for value "keyword">in sorted(reasonable_std_devs): print(f" - {value}") # If we have exactly 2 values, they might be our target standard deviations "keyword">if len(reasonable_std_devs) == 2: std_dev_1, std_dev_2 = sorted(reasonable_std_devs) difference = abs(std_dev_1 - std_dev_2) print(f"\n✅ POTENTIAL ANSWER:") print(f"Standard deviation 1: {std_dev_1}") print(f"Standard deviation 2: {std_dev_2}") print(f"Difference (to 3 decimal places): {difference:.3f}") print(f"\nNote: These values need verification against the original context") "keyword">else: print(f"\n⚠️ No clear standard deviation values found "keyword">in the extracted text") print(f"The target data may be "keyword">in visual/tabular format within the PDFs") print(f"\n📁 FINAL WORKSPACE STATUS:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")
📄 Output

"keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0] print(f"Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") "keyword">else: print("No workspace directory found.") exit() print(f"\nCurrent workspace files:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # Load "keyword">and examine structure safely "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: analysis_data = json.load(f) print(f"Analysis data type: {type(analysis_data)}") "keyword">if isinstance(analysis_data, dict): print(f"Dictionary keys: {list(analysis_data.keys())}") # Check key findings "keyword">if &#x27;key_findings' "keyword">in analysis_data: print(f"\nKey findings structure: {list(analysis_data[&#x27;key_findings'].keys())}") # Look at the citation study data "keyword">if &#x27;citation_study_data' "keyword">in analysis_data['key_findings']: citation_data = analysis_data[&#x27;key_findings']['citation_study_data'] print(f"\nCitation study data: {citation_data}") # The most promising lead "keyword">is the research paper about citation differences # Let's "keyword">try to access it directly research_paper_url = "https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0099133323000733" print(f"\n=== ACCESSING RESEARCH PAPER FOR DETAILED STATISTICAL DATA ===\n") print(f"Target URL: {research_paper_url}") print(f"Expected content: Sample standard deviations "keyword">for Reference Works by academic domains") headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5' } "keyword">try: print(f"\nAttempting to access research paper...") response = requests.get(research_paper_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: print(f"✓ Successfully accessed ({response.status_code})") # Parse HTML content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Remove scripts "keyword">and styles "keyword">for element "keyword">in soup([&#x27;script', 'style']): element.decompose() # Extract text text = soup.get_text() lines = (line.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in text.splitlines()) clean_text = &#x27; '.join(line "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines "keyword">if line) print(f"Extracted text length: {len(clean_text):,} characters") # Save the research paper content paper_filename = &#x27;citation_differences_research_paper.txt' paper_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, paper_filename) "keyword">with open(paper_path, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f"Source: Citation differences across research funding "keyword">and access\n") f.write(f"URL: {research_paper_url}\n") f.write(f"Content Length: {len(clean_text):,} characters\n") f.write("=" * 60 + "\n") f.write(clean_text) print(f"Research paper content saved: {paper_filename} ({len(clean_text):,} characters)") # Search "keyword">for statistical data "keyword">in the research paper content_lower = clean_text.lower() # Look "keyword">for standard deviation patterns std_dev_patterns = { &#x27;standard_deviations': re.findall(r'(?:standard deviation|std\.?\s*dev\.?|σ)\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;sample_statistics': re.findall(r'(?:sample size|n\s*=|sample)\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+)', content_lower), &#x27;life_sciences_stats': re.findall(r'life sciences?[^.]*?(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;health_sciences_stats': re.findall(r'health sciences?[^.]*?(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;reference_works_stats': re.findall(r'reference works?[^.]*?(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;distribution_stats': re.findall(r'distribution[^.]*?(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower) } print(f"\n📊 Statistical patterns found "keyword">in research paper:") "keyword">for pattern_name, matches "keyword">in std_dev_patterns.items(): "keyword">if matches: print(f" {pattern_name}: {matches[:5]}") # Look "keyword">for specific contexts mentioning standard deviations sentences = re.split(r&#x27;[.!?]', clean_text) std_dev_contexts = [] "keyword">for sentence "keyword">in sentences: sentence_clean = sentence.strip() sentence_lower = sentence_clean.lower() "keyword">if &#x27;standard deviation' "keyword">in sentence_lower: std_dev_contexts.append(sentence_clean) "keyword">if std_dev_contexts: print(f"\n🎯 STANDARD DEVIATION CONTEXTS FOUND: {len(std_dev_contexts)}") "keyword">for i, context "keyword">in enumerate(std_dev_contexts[:3], 1): print(f" {i}. {context[:200]}...") # Look "keyword">for the specific data about Life Sciences "keyword">and Health Sciences domain_specific_sentences = [] "keyword">for sentence "keyword">in sentences: sentence_clean = sentence.strip() sentence_lower = sentence_clean.lower() "keyword">if (&#x27;life sciences' "keyword">in sentence_lower "keyword">or 'health sciences' "keyword">in sentence_lower) "keyword">and re.search(r'\d+(?:\.\d+)?', sentence_clean): numbers = re.findall(r&#x27;\d+(?:\.\d+)?', sentence_clean) domain_specific_sentences.append({ &#x27;sentence': sentence_clean, &#x27;numbers': numbers, &#x27;has_life_sciences': 'life sciences' "keyword">in sentence_lower, &#x27;has_health_sciences': 'health sciences' "keyword">in sentence_lower }) print(f"\n📋 DOMAIN-SPECIFIC SENTENCES WITH NUMBERS: {len(domain_specific_sentences)}") "keyword">for i, data "keyword">in enumerate(domain_specific_sentences[:5], 1): print(f" {i}. Numbers: {data[&#x27;numbers']}") print(f" Life Sciences: {data[&#x27;has_life_sciences']}, Health Sciences: {data['has_health_sciences']}") print(f" Text: {data[&#x27;sentence'][:150]}...") # Search "keyword">for table data "keyword">or structured statistical information table_patterns = { &#x27;mean_values': re.findall(r'mean\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;variance_values': re.findall(r'variance\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;correlation_values': re.findall(r'correlation\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;p_values': re.findall(r'p\s*[=<>]\s*(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower) } print(f"\n📈 STATISTICAL MEASURES FOUND:") "keyword">for measure, values "keyword">in table_patterns.items(): "keyword">if values: print(f" {measure}: {values[:5]}") # Try to find the specific sample standard deviations we need # Look "keyword">for patterns like "Life Sciences (SD = X.XX)" "keyword">or similar specific_sd_patterns = [ r&#x27;life sciences?[^.]*?(?:sd|standard deviation)[^.]*?(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', r&#x27;health sciences?[^.]*?(?:sd|standard deviation)[^.]*?(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', r&#x27;(?:sd|standard deviation)[^.]*?life sciences?[^.]*?(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', r&#x27;(?:sd|standard deviation)[^.]*?health sciences?[^.]*?(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)' ] life_sciences_sd = "keyword">None health_sciences_sd = "keyword">None "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in specific_sd_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, content_lower) "keyword">if matches: print(f"\nPattern &#x27;{pattern[:50]}...' found matches: {matches}") # Try to determine which domain this belongs to "keyword">if &#x27;life sciences' "keyword">in pattern: "keyword">if "keyword">not life_sciences_sd "keyword">and matches: life_sciences_sd = float(matches[0]) print(f" -> Potential Life Sciences SD: {life_sciences_sd}") "keyword">if &#x27;health sciences' "keyword">in pattern: "keyword">if "keyword">not health_sciences_sd "keyword">and matches: health_sciences_sd = float(matches[0]) print(f" -> Potential Health Sciences SD: {health_sciences_sd}") # Save research paper analysis paper_analysis = { &#x27;source': 'Citation differences across research funding "keyword">and access research paper', &#x27;url': research_paper_url, &#x27;content_length': len(clean_text), &#x27;statistical_patterns': {k: v "keyword">for k, v "keyword">in std_dev_patterns.items() "keyword">if v}, &#x27;std_dev_contexts': std_dev_contexts[:5], &#x27;domain_specific_data': domain_specific_sentences[:10], &#x27;statistical_measures': {k: v "keyword">for k, v "keyword">in table_patterns.items() "keyword">if v}, &#x27;extracted_standard_deviations': { &#x27;life_sciences_sd': life_sciences_sd, &#x27;health_sciences_sd': health_sciences_sd } } # Calculate difference "keyword">if both values found "keyword">if life_sciences_sd "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">and health_sciences_sd "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None: difference = abs(life_sciences_sd - health_sciences_sd) paper_analysis[&#x27;difference_calculated'] = round(difference, 3) print(f"\n🎯 SUCCESS: SAMPLE STANDARD DEVIATIONS FOUND!") print(f"Life Sciences standard deviation: {life_sciences_sd}") print(f"Health Sciences standard deviation: {health_sciences_sd}") print(f"Difference (to 3 decimal places): {difference:.3f}") # Save the analysis paper_analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;research_paper_statistical_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(paper_analysis_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(paper_analysis, f, indent=2) print(f"\nResearch paper analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(paper_analysis_file)}") "keyword">else: print(f"✗ Failed to access research paper ({response.status_code})") print(f"Response headers: {dict(response.headers)}") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"✗ Error accessing research paper: {e}") # If we couldn't access the research paper, let's "keyword">try a different approach # Let's examine the extracted text files more carefully "keyword">for any missed statistical data print(f"\n=== ALTERNATIVE APPROACH: DEEPER ANALYSIS OF EXISTING FILES ===\n") # Look at the extracted text files again "keyword">with focus on finding standard deviations text_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir) "keyword">if f.endswith(&#x27;_extracted_text.txt')] "keyword">for text_file "keyword">in text_files: text_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, text_file) print(f"\nRe-analyzing: {text_file}") "keyword">with open(text_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: content = f.read() # Search "keyword">for any mention of statistical analysis "keyword">or data tables lines = content.split(&#x27;\n') # Look "keyword">for lines that might contain tabular data potential_table_lines = [] "keyword">for i, line "keyword">in enumerate(lines): line_clean = line.strip() # Look "keyword">for lines "keyword">with multiple numbers separated by spaces "keyword">or tabs "keyword">if re.search(r&#x27;\d+(?:\.\d+)?\s+\d+(?:\.\d+)?', line_clean): potential_table_lines.append({ &#x27;line_number': i+1, &#x27;content': line_clean, &#x27;numbers': re.findall(r'\d+(?:\.\d+)?', line_clean) }) "keyword">if potential_table_lines: print(f" Found {len(potential_table_lines)} potential table lines:") "keyword">for table_line "keyword">in potential_table_lines[:3]: print(f" Line {table_line[&#x27;line_number']}: {table_line['content'][:100]}...") print(f" Numbers: {table_line[&#x27;numbers']}") print(f"\n=== FINAL ANALYSIS SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"✓ Systematic search "keyword">for ScienceDirect Reference Works data completed") print(f"✓ Multiple PDF files analyzed "keyword">and text extracted") print(f"✓ Research paper about citation differences identified "keyword">and accessed") print(f"✓ Statistical patterns "keyword">and numerical data extracted") # 📄 Output

2025-08-11 06:34:02

"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import re print("=== ACCESSING ORIGINAL RESEARCH PAPER FOR SAMPLE STANDARD DEVIATIONS ===\n") # Find workspace directory workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0] print(f"Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") "keyword">else: print("No workspace directory found.") exit() print(f"\nCurrent workspace files:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # First, let's carefully inspect the fixed statistical analysis file to understand what we found analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;fixed_statistical_analysis.json') "keyword">if os.path.exists(analysis_file): print(f"\n=== INSPECTING FIXED STATISTICAL ANALYSIS FILE ===\n") # Read first 300 characters to understand structure "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: sample_content = f.read(300) print("First 300 characters:") print(sample_content) print("...\n") # Load "keyword">and examine structure safely "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;r') "keyword">as f: analysis_data = json.load(f) print(f"Analysis data type: {type(analysis_data)}") "keyword">if isinstance(analysis_data, dict): print(f"Dictionary keys: {list(analysis_data.keys())}") # Check key findings "keyword">if &#x27;key_findings' "keyword">in analysis_data: print(f"\nKey findings structure: {list(analysis_data[&#x27;key_findings'].keys())}") # Look at the citation study data "keyword">if &#x27;citation_study_data' "keyword">in analysis_data['key_findings']: citation_data = analysis_data[&#x27;key_findings']['citation_study_data'] print(f"\nCitation study data: {citation_data}") # Check reasonable standard deviation candidates "keyword">if &#x27;reasonable_std_dev_candidates' "keyword">in analysis_data: candidates = analysis_data[&#x27;reasonable_std_dev_candidates'] print(f"\nReasonable std dev candidates: {candidates}") # The most promising lead "keyword">is the research paper about citation differences # Let's "keyword">try to access it directly research_paper_url = "https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0099133323000733" print(f"\n=== ACCESSING RESEARCH PAPER FOR DETAILED STATISTICAL DATA ===\n") print(f"Target URL: {research_paper_url}") print(f"Expected content: Sample standard deviations "keyword">for Reference Works by academic domains") headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5' } "keyword">try: print(f"\nAttempting to access research paper...") response = requests.get(research_paper_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: print(f"✓ Successfully accessed ({response.status_code})") # Parse HTML content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, &#x27;html.parser') # Remove scripts "keyword">and styles "keyword">for element "keyword">in soup([&#x27;script', 'style']): element.decompose() # Extract text text = soup.get_text() lines = (line.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in text.splitlines()) clean_text = &#x27; '.join(line "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines "keyword">if line) print(f"Extracted text length: {len(clean_text):,} characters") # Save the research paper content paper_filename = &#x27;citation_differences_research_paper.txt' paper_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, paper_filename) "keyword">with open(paper_path, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f"Source: Citation differences across research funding "keyword">and access\n") f.write(f"URL: {research_paper_url}\n") f.write(f"Content Length: {len(clean_text):,} characters\n") f.write("=" * 60 + "\n") f.write(clean_text) print(f"Research paper content saved: {paper_filename} ({len(clean_text):,} characters)") # Search "keyword">for statistical data "keyword">in the research paper content_lower = clean_text.lower() # Look "keyword">for standard deviation patterns std_dev_patterns = { &#x27;standard_deviations': re.findall(r'(?:standard deviation|std\.?\s*dev\.?|σ)\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;sample_statistics': re.findall(r'(?:sample size|n\s*=|sample)\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+)', content_lower), &#x27;life_sciences_stats': re.findall(r'life sciences?[^.]*?(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;health_sciences_stats': re.findall(r'health sciences?[^.]*?(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;reference_works_stats': re.findall(r'reference works?[^.]*?(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;distribution_stats': re.findall(r'distribution[^.]*?(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower) } print(f"\n📊 Statistical patterns found "keyword">in research paper:") "keyword">for pattern_name, matches "keyword">in std_dev_patterns.items(): "keyword">if matches: print(f" {pattern_name}: {matches[:5]}") # Look "keyword">for specific contexts mentioning standard deviations sentences = re.split(r&#x27;[.!?]', clean_text) std_dev_contexts = [] "keyword">for sentence "keyword">in sentences: sentence_clean = sentence.strip() sentence_lower = sentence_clean.lower() "keyword">if &#x27;standard deviation' "keyword">in sentence_lower: std_dev_contexts.append(sentence_clean) "keyword">if std_dev_contexts: print(f"\n🎯 STANDARD DEVIATION CONTEXTS FOUND: {len(std_dev_contexts)}") "keyword">for i, context "keyword">in enumerate(std_dev_contexts[:3], 1): print(f" {i}. {context[:200]}...") # Look "keyword">for the specific data about Life Sciences "keyword">and Health Sciences domain_specific_sentences = [] "keyword">for sentence "keyword">in sentences: sentence_clean = sentence.strip() sentence_lower = sentence_clean.lower() "keyword">if (&#x27;life sciences' "keyword">in sentence_lower "keyword">or 'health sciences' "keyword">in sentence_lower) "keyword">and re.search(r'\d+(?:\.\d+)?', sentence_clean): numbers = re.findall(r&#x27;\d+(?:\.\d+)?', sentence_clean) domain_specific_sentences.append({ &#x27;sentence': sentence_clean, &#x27;numbers': numbers, &#x27;has_life_sciences': 'life sciences' "keyword">in sentence_lower, &#x27;has_health_sciences': 'health sciences' "keyword">in sentence_lower }) print(f"\n📋 DOMAIN-SPECIFIC SENTENCES WITH NUMBERS: {len(domain_specific_sentences)}") "keyword">for i, data "keyword">in enumerate(domain_specific_sentences[:5], 1): print(f" {i}. Numbers: {data[&#x27;numbers']}") print(f" Life Sciences: {data[&#x27;has_life_sciences']}, Health Sciences: {data['has_health_sciences']}") print(f" Text: {data[&#x27;sentence'][:150]}...") # Search "keyword">for table data "keyword">or structured statistical information table_patterns = { &#x27;mean_values': re.findall(r'mean\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;variance_values': re.findall(r'variance\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;correlation_values': re.findall(r'correlation\s*[=:]?\s*(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower), &#x27;p_values': re.findall(r'p\s*[=<>]\s*(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', content_lower) } print(f"\n📈 STATISTICAL MEASURES FOUND:") "keyword">for measure, values "keyword">in table_patterns.items(): "keyword">if values: print(f" {measure}: {values[:5]}") # Try to find the specific sample standard deviations we need # Look "keyword">for patterns like "Life Sciences (SD = X.XX)" "keyword">or similar specific_sd_patterns = [ r&#x27;life sciences?[^.]*?(?:sd|standard deviation)[^.]*?(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', r&#x27;health sciences?[^.]*?(?:sd|standard deviation)[^.]*?(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', r&#x27;(?:sd|standard deviation)[^.]*?life sciences?[^.]*?(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)', r&#x27;(?:sd|standard deviation)[^.]*?health sciences?[^.]*?(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)' ] life_sciences_sd = "keyword">None health_sciences_sd = "keyword">None "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in specific_sd_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, content_lower) "keyword">if matches: print(f"\nPattern &#x27;{pattern[:50]}...' found matches: {matches}") # Try to determine which domain this belongs to "keyword">if &#x27;life sciences' "keyword">in pattern: "keyword">if "keyword">not life_sciences_sd "keyword">and matches: life_sciences_sd = float(matches[0]) print(f" -> Potential Life Sciences SD: {life_sciences_sd}") "keyword">if &#x27;health sciences' "keyword">in pattern: "keyword">if "keyword">not health_sciences_sd "keyword">and matches: health_sciences_sd = float(matches[0]) print(f" -> Potential Health Sciences SD: {health_sciences_sd}") # Save research paper analysis paper_analysis = { &#x27;source': 'Citation differences across research funding "keyword">and access research paper', &#x27;url': research_paper_url, &#x27;content_length': len(clean_text), &#x27;statistical_patterns': {k: v "keyword">for k, v "keyword">in std_dev_patterns.items() "keyword">if v}, &#x27;std_dev_contexts': std_dev_contexts[:5], &#x27;domain_specific_data': domain_specific_sentences[:10], &#x27;statistical_measures': {k: v "keyword">for k, v "keyword">in table_patterns.items() "keyword">if v}, &#x27;extracted_standard_deviations': { &#x27;life_sciences_sd': life_sciences_sd, &#x27;health_sciences_sd': health_sciences_sd } } # Calculate difference "keyword">if both values found "keyword">if life_sciences_sd "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">and health_sciences_sd "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None: difference = abs(life_sciences_sd - health_sciences_sd) paper_analysis[&#x27;difference_calculated'] = round(difference, 3) print(f"\n🎯 SUCCESS: SAMPLE STANDARD DEVIATIONS FOUND!") print(f"Life Sciences standard deviation: {life_sciences_sd}") print(f"Health Sciences standard deviation: {health_sciences_sd}") print(f"Difference (to 3 decimal places): {difference:.3f}") # Save the analysis paper_analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;research_paper_statistical_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(paper_analysis_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(paper_analysis, f, indent=2) print(f"\nResearch paper analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(paper_analysis_file)}") "keyword">else: print(f"✗ Failed to access research paper ({response.status_code})") print(f"Response headers: {dict(response.headers)}") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"✗ Error accessing research paper: {e}") # If we couldn't access the research paper, let's "keyword">try a different approach # Let's examine the extracted text files more carefully "keyword">for any missed statistical data print(f"\n=== ALTERNATIVE APPROACH: DEEPER ANALYSIS OF EXISTING FILES ===\n") # Look at the extracted text files again "keyword">with focus on finding standard deviations text_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir) "keyword">if f.endswith(&#x27;_extracted_text.txt')] "keyword">for text_file "keyword">in text_files: text_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, text_file) print(f"\nRe-analyzing: {text_file}") "keyword">with open(text_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: content = f.read() # Search "keyword">for any mention of statistical analysis "keyword">or data tables lines = content.split(&#x27;\n') # Look "keyword">for lines that might contain tabular data potential_table_lines = [] "keyword">for i, line "keyword">in enumerate(lines): line_clean = line.strip() # Look "keyword">for lines "keyword">with multiple numbers separated by spaces "keyword">or tabs "keyword">if re.search(r&#x27;\d+(?:\.\d+)?\s+\d+(?:\.\d+)?', line_clean): potential_table_lines.append({ &#x27;line_number': i+1, &#x27;content': line_clean, &#x27;numbers': re.findall(r'\d+(?:\.\d+)?', line_clean) }) "keyword">if potential_table_lines: print(f" Found {len(potential_table_lines)} potential table lines:") "keyword">for table_line "keyword">in potential_table_lines[:3]: print(f" Line {table_line[&#x27;line_number']}: {table_line['content'][:100]}...") print(f" Numbers: {table_line[&#x27;numbers']}") print(f"\n=== FINAL ANALYSIS SUMMARY ===\n") print(f"✓ Systematic search "keyword">for ScienceDirect Reference Works data completed") print(f"✓ Multiple PDF files analyzed "keyword">and text extracted") print(f"✓ Research paper about citation differences identified "keyword">and accessed") print(f"✓ Statistical patterns "keyword">and numerical data extracted") # Check "keyword">if we found the target standard deviations "keyword">if &#x27;life_sciences_sd' "keyword">in locals() "keyword">and 'health_sciences_sd' "keyword">in locals(): "keyword">if life_sciences_sd "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None "keyword">and health_sciences_sd "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None: print(f"\n🎯 FINAL ANSWER:") print(f"Life Sciences sample standard deviation: {life_sciences_sd}") print(f"Health Sciences sample standard deviation: {health_sciences_sd}") print(f"Difference (to 3 decimal places): {abs(life_sciences_sd - health_sciences_sd):.3f}") "keyword">else: print(f"\n⚠️ Standard deviations "keyword">not definitively identified") "keyword">else: print(f"\n⚠️ Target sample standard deviations "keyword">not found "keyword">in available sources") print(f"The specific statistical data may require access to the full research paper") print(f""keyword">or may be embedded "keyword">in visual elements (tables, charts) within the PDFs") print(f"\n📁 FINAL WORKSPACE STATUS:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")
